characters: ENERGY RIPPLES FROM THE MACHINE... PIPES/TAPS/DRAINS EXPL
HE IS YANKED INTO THE DARKNESS WITH AN ECHOING CRY-
BATMAN. PUT DOWN YOUR WEAPONS AND
CONCRETEMETAL SHREDDING, MARBLE SHATTERING, DUST CLOUDS
BLACKNESS SIDESWIPES THE THIRD THUG, SPINNING HIM OFF HIS
BLINDING HEADLIGHTS FLARE. A MASSIVE ENGINE ROARS-
CRASHING DOWN INTO WAYNE PLAZA- DIGGING THROUGH THE
FEET, WHIPPING HIM INTO DARKNESS WITH A PIERCING SCREAM..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BRUCE peers down rows of plants on long trestle tables.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: Rachel? No response. Sunlight streams through wrought iron and glass. Young Bruce advances, cautious. He is GRABBED from behind and pulled under a table by a young girl, aged 10. This is RACHEL. She puts her hand over Young Bruce’s mout

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rachel?! Master Bruce?! A woman STRIDES past the windows: MRS.DODSON, Rachel’s mother, housekeeper of Wayne Manor.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: (whispering) What’re you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) Kidnapping you. They” pay a lot for precious Brucie. Young Bruce stares, wide-eyed. She SMILES. He relaxes. Yo Bruce BOLTS out from under the trestle table - SPRINTS fo the back door. Rachel TEARS after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Bruce crouches in the mouth of a DISUSED WELL, peer over the stone wall at Rachel, who searches for him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Bruce, I can see you. Young Bruce suppresses a giggle- the BOARDS beneath him G WAY and he PLUMMETS into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Bruce DROPS thirty feet- LANDS painfully on the rub strewn bottom of the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, hearing, RUNS to the well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Bruce lifts his head from damp dirt and rocks, groaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel SPRINTS towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Bruce, in shock, groans. He hears SQUEALING- freeze PEERING into the DARKNESS of an OPENING between rocks... BATS EXPLODE from the darkness, filling the air. HE SCREAMSCURLS against their flapping, squawking, flutterin BLACKNESS. A JOLT: OLDER GREEN EYES FLICK OPEN, WAKING... in DARKNES Filthy, sweating darkness... and we are in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyes belong to a bearded, weathered, young man’s face BRUCE WAYNE aged 28. An OLD ASIAN MAN sits staring at him

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: A dream?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: A nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Worse than this? Their cell is a tin box. Light seeps through gaps in the roof. Shouts ECHO. Wayne shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and the Old Man line up for gruel. PRISONERS are scattered in small groups. All eyes on Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: They are going to fight you.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I fought them yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: They will fight you every day. Until they kill you. Wayne holds out his plate. Watches gruel dribbled onto it

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Can’t they kill me before breakfast? Wayne turns from the table. His path is blocked by an ENORMOUS MAN, backed by six aggressive prisoners. The Enormous Man SMASHES his plate away.

dialogues.speaker: ENORMOUS MAN
dialogues.text: (broken English) You are in hell, little man... He PUNCHES Wayne- Wayne goes down hard. ENORMOUS MAN (CONT’D) ...and I am the devil. Wayne picks himself up. Dust himself off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 CONTINUED: (2) 4.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You’re not the devil... The Enormous Man SWINGS again- Wayne CATCHES his fist, KI the big man’s knee out an, as he goes down, BOOTS his fac WAYNE (CONT’D) ...you’re practice. Six Prisoners RUSH Wayne all at once... Wayne fights skillfully and hard, FLIPPING one prisoner into another KICKING as his arms are held... several Prisoners hit the deck before- GUNFIRE- two GUARDS break it up, shooting in the air... they GRAB Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Solitary!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (indignant ) Why?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: For protection.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I don’t need protection. The Guard points angrily at the unconscious prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Protection for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne is tossed into the dark cell. The door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I often wonder at the riches to be found in dark places. The voice is mellifluous. European. It comes from the shadows of a deep corner of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I thought the point of solitary confinement was the solitary part. Wayne can make out the profile of a MAN seated in the corner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: These men have mistaken you for a criminal, Mr.Wayne... Wayne reacts to his name. The Man steps into the light: powerfully-built, distinguished, in a well-cut SUIT AND T

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: My name is merely Ducard. But I speak for Ra’s Al Ghul. Have you heard the name?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’ve heard the legends...master warrior, international mercenary, feared by all the underworld... some even swear he’s immortal.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: (smiles) Ra’s Al Ghul uses theatricality and deception as powerful weapons. Ducard approaches Wayne. Looks deep into his eyes. DUCARD (CONT’D) You have not escaped his notice- a man like you is here by choice... or because he is truly lost. Wayne’s eyes flick away from Ducard’s penetrating gaze. DUCARD (CONT’D) Ra’s Al Ghul and his League of Shadows offer a path to those that are capable of upholding our code.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Code? Aren’t you criminals?

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: A criminal is simply a man that someone else thinks... (gestures around them) should be put in jail. Wayne nods, conceding the point. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 12 CONTINUED: (3) 6. DUCARD (CONT’D) This world is run by tyrants and corrupt bureaucrats. Our code respects only the natural order of things- we’re not bound by their hypocrisy. Are you? Ducard moves to the door. Knocks. It is opened by a guard DUCARD (CONT’D) There is a rare flower- a blue doublebloomed poppy- that grows on the Eastern slopes. Tomorrow you will be released. Pick one of the flowers. If you can carry it to the top of the mountain, you may find what you are looking for.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: And what am I looking for? Ducard looks at Wayne with a glint in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Purpose. The door slams shut leaving Wayne in DARKNESS... INT. BOTTOM OF THE OLD WELL -- DAY (WAYNE’S MEMORY) 11 Silence. Young Bruce lies there, exhausted, weeping softl

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Bruce? Young Bruce looks up: a FIGURE, long coat billowing, is lowered down the shaft... THOMAS WAYNE, Young Bruce’s father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas carries his son towards the house. At his side, a year-old man in a somber suit calmly coils a rope: ALFRED

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Will we be needing an ambulance, Master Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We have everything I need to set the bone. I’1l1 take him for x-rays later. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 15 CONTINUED: (2) 7.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. They pass a tearful Rachel standing with her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas carries Bruce up the main stairs. The house is vas and grand, but full of flowers and life. Bruce’s Mother (MARTHA) appears at the landing, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (reassuring) He’1l be fine. INT. BRUCE’S BEDROOM, WAYNE MANOR -- LATER 14 Alfred moves to the bedside. Looks down at Young Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Took quite a fall, didn’t we? Young Bruce looks up at Alfred. Manages a slight smile.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: And why do we fall, Master Bruce? Alfred reaches up to the curtains. Young Bruce says nothi

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: So that we might better learn to pick ourselves up. Alfred smiles gently. PULLS the curtains shut, and we-

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: An exquisite double-bloomed BLUE POPPY... and we are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A field of the blue poppies. Wayne approaches. Picks one. Studies its brilliant blue in the cold sunshine.  16 17 18 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, exhausted, freezing, hungry, wanders up the street As locals see him they head inside. DOORS SLAMMED, BOLTED

dialogues.speaker: CHILD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No one will help you. Wayne turns to find a YOUNG CHILD STARING at him. The Chi POINTS at the blue flower pinned to Wayne’s chest. An OLD MAN appears at the Child’s side.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (weak) I need food.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Then turn back. Wayne looks at the Old Man. Then carries on up the mounta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, struggles through DRIVING SNOW up an ICY RIDGE... He clears the ridge, FLOPS down into the snow, Painfully raises his scarf-wrapped face to the cutting wind to see MONASTERY perched on jagged rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne climbs up the steps to the VAST DOORS of the monastery. Unwraps a severely FROSTBITTEN FIST. POUNDS against the icecovered wood, knocks ECHOING deep within. Nothing. Wayne lowers his forehead to the door, shoulders wracked by SOBS, pounding accelerating to a FRENZY. A GRINDING noise from within. Wayne STOPS, straightens. T doors SWING OPEN to DARKNESS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne shuffles forward into a low-ceilinged wooden hall l by flickering lamps. Hands trembling, Wayne pulls at brit scarves. He STARTS as the doors THUD shut behind him. At the far end, on a raised platform, sits a dark robbed figure; RA’S AL GHUL. Wayne moves unsteadily towards him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Ra’s Al Ghul? ARMED WARRIORS of various races emerge from the SHADOWS: BOWS taut, SWORDS drawn... NINJAS. Wayne freezes.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wait. The Warriors hold. Wayne looks at the source of the comma Ducard leans against a nearby pillar. Wayne reaches into his layers of clothing. Pulls out the DOUBLE-BLOOMED BLUE POPPY. Holds it out, shaking. Ra’s Al Ghul starts to speak in Urdu. Ducard TRANSLATES.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Fear has been your guide. But now you must advance or fear will keep you on your knees. We will help you conquer your fear. In exchange you will renounce the cities of man. You will live in solitude. You will be a member of the Leagues of Shadows. And you will be without fear. Ducard takes the flower. Considers its delicate blue peta DUCARD (CONT’D) Are you ready to begin? Ducard threads the flower through the buttonhole of his lapel. Wayne looks at Ducard, shaking with hunger and fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Ready? I... I can barely- Ducard KICKS him- Wayne Crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Death does not wait for you to be ready... Wayne crawls, gasping. Ducard STRIKES him in the ribs. DUCARD (CONT’D) Death is not considerate, or fair. And make no mistake- today, death is your opponent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducard turns- WHIPS his leg in a fearsome roundhouse KICK aimed straight at Wayne’s NECK- -but Wayne BLOCKS the kick with a lateral movement of his forearm. He stares at Ducard, eyes BLAZING. Ducard SMILES Wayne RISES. Assumes a martial STANCE. Ducard STRIKESWayn BLOCKS and PARRIES, driving his body through pain into a series of FLUID, SKILLED moves... DUCARD (CONT’D) Tiger Crane... Ju Jitsu... (smiles) Skilled. But this is not a dance- Ducard GRAPPLES Wayne, BRAWLING, BITING, ENERGIZED, MESSY DUCARD (CONT’D) Facing death you learn the truth... Ducard’s head smashes Wayne’s cheek- Wayne FALTERS- DUCARD (CONT’D) You are weak... Ducard SMASHES him in the groin. DUCARD (CONT’D) You are alone... Ducard SLAMS Wayne’s chin, sends him DOWN HARD. DUCARD (CONT’D) And you are afraid... Ducard crouches at Wayne’s side. Looks into his glazed ey DUCARD (CONT’D) (curious) But not of me. Ducard pulls the flower from his lapel. Leans in close to replace it on Wayne’s chest, his lips at Wayne’s ear... DUCARD (CONT’D) Tell us, Wayne... VIOLENT FLAPPING, SCREECHING BLACK RATS- swarming, chittering-

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (whispers) What do you fear?  20 11. Young Bruce’s eyes OPEN, and we are- INT. BRUCE’S BEDROOM, WAYNE MANOR -- DAWN (WAYNE’S MEMORY Young Bruce, breathing hard. Light cuts across the bedclothes. He looks to the door. Thomas is there.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (gentle) The bats again? Young Bruce nods. Thomas approaches. Sits on the bed. THOMAS (CONT’D) You know why they attacked you? (off look) They were afraid of you.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: Afraid of me?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You’re a lot bigger than a bat, aren’t you? All creatures feel fear.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Even the scary ones? Thomas smiles back, reaches into his dressing gown pocket

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Especially the scary ones. (thinks) Here, let me show you something- (freeze) But you can’t tell anyone, right? Young Bruce nods, eager. Thomas pulls out a long jewel ca He opens it: PEARLS glow in the half-light. THOMAS (CONT’D) For your mother. Young Bruce GRINS. Thomas winks at him, SNAPS the case sh  21 22 23 24 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Bruce watches the glory of Gotham glide past. His parents beside him, dressed up- Martha idly stroking her pearls. She smiles at Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: Did you build this train, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Your great-grandfather built the first trains in Gotham. The city’s been good to our family- it was time to give something back... Thomas draws a CIRCLE in the CONDENSATION on the window.. THOMAS (CONT’D) A new public transportation system for the whole city... Thomas draws SPOKES through the circle, creating a WHEEL. Thomas TAPS his diagram at the central HUB of the wheel, then points through the glass to a tall 1930’s SKYSCRAPER THOMAS (CONT’D) ...and at the cent... Wayne Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monorail train TURNS INWARDS on a "SPOKE"... SHOOTING towards the central station at the base of Wayne Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Bruce STARES at the MAGNIFICENT STATION. He looks u through the vaulted glass ceiling... WAYNE TOWER rises above... Rich ORCHESTRAL STRINGS rise, and we are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gilded house packed to the rafters for Boito’s Mefistof Young Bruce seated between his parents, On stage: WITCHLI CREATURES cavort. DARK BIRDS on wires descend, FLAPPING. Young Bruce STARES, uneasy, at their VIOLENT motions. INSERT CUT: BATS EXPLODE FROM A DARK CREVICE. Young Bruce starts breathing faster, STARES fixedly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 CONTINUED: (2) 13. SCREECHING, FLAPPING BLACK BATS SWARM ALL AROUND... Young Bruce, gulping PANIC breaths, looks around for an exit- they’re in the middle of a row. He GRABS his Dad’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: (desperate whisper) Can we go?! Thomas stares at his son, confused. Martha looks over. Yo Bruce looks at his father, PLEADING. Thomas nods. They ma their way along the row, Thomas nodding apologies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waynes emerge from a side exit. Martha crouches befor Bruce, tries to meet his eyes. He stares down, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Bruce, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He’s fine. Martha looks up. Thomas gives her a conspiratorial look. THOMAS (CONT’D) I just needed a bit of air. Bit of opera goes a long way, right, Bruce? Young Bruce looks up at his Dad, who winks. Young Bruce smiles gratefully. THOMAS (CONT’D) Come one. Thomas, coat over his arm, ushers his family down the dar alley, heading for the WELCOMING GLOW of the main bouleva A FIGURE emerges from the shadows in front of them. A MAN With a GUN. Shifting uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Wallet, jewelry! Fast!

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (calm tone) That’s fine, just take it easy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas hands Young Bruce his coat, then reaches for his wallet. The Man JERKS the gun at Thomas, eyes DARTING. Yo Bruce stares up at the gun TREMBLING in the Man’s hand. THOMAS (CONT’D) Here you go. The man GRABS at the wallet but FUMBLES it. It FALLS. The Man glances down at the wallet then back to Thomas, scare THOMAS (CONT’D) (reassuring tone) It’s fine, it’s fine... The Man crouches for the wallet, eyes on Thomas. THOMAS (CONT’D) ...just take it and go. The Man feels for the wallet, looks at Martha. Her pearls

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I said jewelry!! She starts pulling off her rings. The Man JERKS the gun a her neck. Thomas STEPS protectively in front of his wife.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Hey, just- BOOM. Young Bruce FLINCHES. Thomas looks down at his bleeding chest. Then back to the Man, saddened. Thomas CRUMPLES. Martha SCREAMS. The Man REACHES for Martha’s pearls- but she SCREAMS desperately for Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Gimme the damn... But Martha FLAILS, trying to grab her fallen husband. The Man SHOOTS her. Then YANKS at her necklace, which BREAKS. Spilling PEARLS all over the asphalt. The Man stands. Turns to Young Bruce. Who STARES at him. Uncomprehending. The Man cannot bear the boy’s gaze... And then he RUNS. Young Bruce looks at the bodies of his parents. DROPS to his knees, head down: PEARLS dot the asphalt beneath him. Some of them are bloody.  26 27 15. Young Bruce starts to SHIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS: REPORTERS and COPS vying for a piece of the crime the decade. In the Captain’s office, Young Bruce. Bewildered, forgotten. Still clutching his father’s overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that your father’s? Young Bruce looks up: a young beat cop stands over him- J GORDON (29). Gordon crouches, reaches for the coat. Young Bruce huddles over it, protective.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (reassuring)
It’s okay. Gordon’s tone prompts Young Bruce to trust him. Gordon ta the coat, DRAPES it gently across Young Bruce’s shoulders

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: GORDON! You gotta stick your nose into everything! Gordon turns to CAPTAIN LOEB, who glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN LOEB
dialogues.text: Outta my sight. Gordon NODS at Young Bruce, whose eyes wish Gordon would stay. Gordon leaves. Loeb turns to Young Bruce. CAPTAIN LOEB (CONT’D) Good news... we got him, son. Young Bruce looks up at him dazed. Uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls over two open graves. MOURNERS disperse, guide by SECURITY GUARDS. Alfred stands with Young Bruce. A man approaches, EARLE (47). He nods at Alfred, crouching.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: (indicates Alfred) You’re in excellent hands, Bruce. And we’re minding the empire. When you’re all grown up, it’ll be waiting.  28 29 16. Young Bruce looks blankly at Earle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mourners file towards the gates. Rachel walks with her mother. Looks up at Bruce’s high window. Sees him watchin Waves. Young Bruce pauses, then returns the wave. INT. BRUCE’S BEDROOM -- CONTINUOUS 29 Alfred enters. Looks tenderly at Young Bruce’s back.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I thought I’d prepare a little supper. No response. Alfred turns. ALFRED (CONT’D) Very well.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alfred? Alfred turns back. Young Bruce is looking at him with TEA POURING down his cheeks. Alfred tilts his head.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (voice catching) Master Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: It was my fault, Alfred. Alfred’s mouth opens. YOUNG BRUCE (CONT’D) I made them leave the theater-

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no- Alfred moves to Young Bruce, taking the boy in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: If I hadn’t got scared-

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: No, no, Master Bruce. Nothing you did. Nothing anyone ever did can excuse that man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 31 CONTINUED: (2) 17. Alfred holds Young Bruce away to look directly into his eyes. ALFRED (CONT’D) It’s his, and his alone. Do you understand? Young Bruce nods. Then BURIES his face in Alfred’s chest, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: I miss them, Alfred. I miss them so much.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (whispering) So do I, Master Bruce. So do I. Tears well in Alfred’s eyes as he HOLDS the boy, watching snowflakes swirl past the window.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And do you still feel responsible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducard leads Wayne along a screened passage overlooking extraordinary mountains.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: My anger outweighs my guilt. Ducard opens a door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leads Wayne onto a MEZZANINE LEVEL stacked with boxes and bottles. NINJAS pour powders into packets, mixing compoun Ducard takes a pinch of a powder- throws it down- BANG! Wayne FLINCHES- Ducard SMILES good-naturedly.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Advanced techniques of Ninjitsu employ explosive powders.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: As weapons?

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Or distractions. Theatricality and deception are powerful agents. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 CONTINUED: (2) 18. Ducard hands Wayne a pinch of the powder. DUCARD (CONT’D) To be a great warrior is not enough. Flesh and blood, however skilled, can be destroyed... you must be more than just a man in the minds of your opponents. Wayne listens to this. Tosses the powder- BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and Ducard CIRCLE each other on the ICE, SWORDS poi to strike. Dark figures in the white and blue landscape. Ducard STRIKES at Wayne, who DEFLECTS the blow using a SILVER GAUNTLET with THREE SCALLOPS (thick, hook-like projections). Ducard SKIDS left, breath STEAMING, feintin with his sword. Wayne steps sideways on the ice, his foot landing on a th patch which CREAKS, water BUBBLING underneath.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Mind your surrounding. Always. Wayne STRIKES- Ducard BLOCKS with his own BRONZE GAUNTLET Wayne SLIPS right and FLIES IN with a short THRUST- Ducar arm flips down in a backhand move- Ducard CATCHES Wayne’s sword in one of his SCALLOPS. DUCARD (CONT’D) Your parent’s death was not your fault... Ducard ROTATES his arm, WRENCHING Wayne’s sword from his grasp- it SKIDS along the ice. DUCARD (CONT’D) ...it was your father’s. Wayne, ENRAGES, dives at Ducard, SWINGING at him with the scallops, FURIOUS, RECKLESS. Ducard parries with his swor they LOCK- noses inches apart, Wayne BREATHING... ANGRY.. DUCARD (CONT’D) Anger does not change the fact that your father failed to act. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: The man had a gun!

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Would that stop you?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’ve had training-

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: The training is nothing. The will to take control is everything. Your father trusted his city, its logic... he thought he understood the attacker and could simply give him what he wanted... Wayne considers this... breathing slowing... CALMER... th separate. DUCARD (CONT’D) (gently) Your father did not understand the forces of decay- cities like Gotham are in their death throes- chaotic, grotesque. Beyond saving.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Beyond saving? You believe that? Ducard regards the harshly beautiful landscape.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: It is not right that one must come so far to see the world as it is meant to be. Purity. Serenity... Solitude. These are the qualities we hold dear. But the important thing is whether you believe it... Wayne stares at Ducard. DUCARD (CONT’D) Can Gotham can be saved, or is she an ailing ancestor whose time has run? Ducard STRIKES DOWN at Wayne with his sword. Wayne BLOCKS the strike with FOREARMS CROSSED, SLIDES BETWEEN DUCARD’S LEGS across the ice to where his sword lies. GRASPING his sword he SPINS, SWEEPING at Ducard’s feet. Ducard LEAPS- Wayne CATCHES his foot, brings him down ont the ice. Wayne THRUSTS his sword at Ducard’s throat- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 34 CONTINUED: (3) 20. STOPS INCHES from Ducard’s bare neck. Ducard freezes, arm at his sides. Wayne looks down at Ducard, SMILING in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yield. Ducard smiles. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: You haven’t beaten me. You’ve sacrificed sure footing for a killing stroke. Ducard TAPS the ice beneath Wayne’s feet with his sword- ice gives way, PLUNGING Wayne through the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducard feeds a small FIRE. Wayne RUBS his arms, SHIVERING violently against hypothermia. Ducard looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Don’t rub your arms, rub your chest. Your arms’1l1 take care of themselves. Wayne rubs his torso, NODS at Ducard. Ducard feeds the fi DUCARD (CONT’D) You have strength born of years of grief and anger, Wayne. The strength of a man denied revenge. Even in his shivering, Wayne REACTS to this. DUCARD (CONT’D) Why, Wayne. .? INT. WAYNE STATION PLATFORM -- DAY (WAYNE’S MEMORY) 34 A monorail pulls into the platform. Disgorges passengers.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Why could you not avenge your parents? Amongst them, Bruce, AGED 20, holding a bag. He sees Alfr now 62, craning his neck, SEARCHING. He waves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 36 CONTINUED: (2) 21.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to pick me up-

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Well, sir, the red line... well, it’s closed. Apparently Mr.Earle thought it wasn’t making enough money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks sadly at the DECAY to his father’s station: glass CRACKED, marble chipped, HOMELESS bundled in shutte storefronts... He looks up through the sparing glass: WAY TOWER looms overhead, gold lettering catching the sun...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: How is Mr.Earle?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Oh... successful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred glances at Bruce in the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Will you be heading back to Princeton tomorrow or could I persuade you to spend an extra night or two?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I’m not heading back at all.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: You don’t like it there? Bruce smiles, sardonic. Looks out at the trees flashing b

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I like it fine... they just don’t feel the same way. Alfred purses his lips, IRRITATED.  37 38 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce STARES up at house. Alfred pulls the bag out of the car and, to Bruce’s surprise, DROPS it at Bruce’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred leads Bruce up the main staircase. The house is no dark and empty. Dust-cloths cover much of the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (tense) I’ve prepared the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: My old room will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (stern) With all due respect, sir, your father is dead. Wayne Manor is your house.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (irritated) No, Alfred, his isn’t my house. (gestures) It’s a mausoleum. A reminder of everything I lost. And when I have my way I’1l1 pull the damn thing down brick by brick- Alfred turns on Bruce, angry.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: This house, Master Wayne, has sheltered six generations of the Wayne family, and stood patiently by while you’ve cavorted in and out of a dozen private schools and colleges. As have I. Bruce stares at Alfred. Eyes burning. Chastened. ALFRED (CONT’D) (softer) The Wayne family legacy is not so easily shrugged off.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (sadly) Nor borne, old friend. I’m sorry to have disappointed you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 CONTINUED: (2) 23.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Master Wayne... I was at your father’s side when you were born. And at your side when he was laid to rest.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (voice catching) I know.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Your father was a great man. But I have every confidence that you will exceed his greatness.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Haven’t given up on me, yet?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (conviction) Never. Bruce sags under the burden of Alfred’s faith. He opens t door to his bedroom, then turns back to Alfred...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I may not get another chance to thank you for all you’ve done for me. Alfred looks at him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Are you going away after the hearing? Bruce shrugs, hard to read. Then enters his old bedroom. INT. BRUCE’S BEDROOM -- CONTINUOUS 39 Bruce puts his bag on the bed. Looks around the room. At the mantel, Bruce stares at a framed photograph: Young Bruce on his Dad’s shoulders, arms raised in triumph. Bru wipes dust from the photograph. Smiles at it. INSERT CUT: Young bruce on Thomas’s shoulders- Thomas TIP back, threatening to drop Young Bruce who LAUGHS and LAUG Bruce moves to the bed. Opens his case. Inside it is a GUN.  40 41 42 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, now 23, stands by her car looking up at the house She can see Bruce in the window. She gives a small wave. INT. BRUCE’S BEDROOM -- CONTINUOUS 41 Bruce returns Rachel’s wave. Then FINISHES LOADING HIS GU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce walks down the drive to Rachel. He smiles gently.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You look well. "Assistant District Attorney", right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (nods, smiles) You still trying to get kicked out of the entire ivy league?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (shakes head, smiling) Turns out you don’t actually need a degree to do the international playboy thing. Rachel smiles. Looks down at her shoes. Then back to Bruc

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Bruce, I don’t suppose there’s any way I can convince you not to come-

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (cold) Someone at this proceeding should stand for my parents.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Bruce, we all loved your parents. What Chill did is unforgivable-

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Then why is your boss letting him go?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Because in prison he shared a cell with Carmine Falcone. He learned things and he’ll testify in exchange for early parole.  43 44 45 25. Bruce shakes his head, opens the car door. Rachel sighs. INT./EXT. RACHEL’S CAR ON FREEWAY, GOTHAM -- MORNING 43 Rachel’s car heads towards the golden spires of Gotham. Bruce stares out the window in silence. INT. RACHEL’S CAR -- MOMENTS LATER 44 Rachel pulls into the PARKING LOT of the COURTHOUSE. Park Bruce looks at her through the strained silence.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Rachel, this man killed my parents. I cannot let that pass. Rachel almost says something. Then SHRUGS. BRUCE (CONT’D) Rachel, I need you to understand. Rachel looks at Bruce. Considering. Gently NODS. Bruce no back. Rachel opens her door and starts getting out. Bruce slips out his GUN, placing it on the ground behind front wheel of Rachel’s car as he gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bureaucratic proceeding. A five person PANEL. Bru sits amongst the OBSERVERS. Watching the back of Chili’s head. Rachel’s boss, FINCH, addresses the panel.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Given the exemplary prison record of Mr.Chill, the 14 years already served and his extraordinary level of cooperation with one of this office’s most important investigations... we strongly endorse Mr.Chill’s petition for early release. The CHAIRMAN nods, consults his paperwork

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: I gather a member of the Wayne family is here today... Chill REACTS, TURNING. Bruce STUDIES his weathered face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 CONTINUED: (2) 26.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...does he have anything to say? Chill notices Wayne’s cold eyes. Has to look away. Bruce RISES, walks out, all eyes on him. Including Rachel’s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce MOVES to Rachel’s car. Picks up his GUN, stuffs it the sleeve of his overcoat. Waits. The side exit opens and two COPS come out. A shout goes u from the pressmen around the front of the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: They’re taking him out the side!! REPORTERS swarm around the building as Chill emerges.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER1
dialogues.text: Chill, any words for the Wayne family?!! Chill, head down, presses on. Bruce straightens. Breathes Starts WALKING towards Chill. A Reporter SPOTS him.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER2
dialogues.text: It’s Bruce Wayne! The Reporters clear a path, eager for a confrontation.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Joe! Hey Joe!! This one catches Chill’s eye- blonde, local t.v. type. Bruce’s hand DROPS to his side as he MOVES... he’s BREATH HARD... THINKING... DECIDING... BLONDE FEMALE REPORTER (CONT’D) Falcone says hi!! She THRUSTS a gun at Chill’s chest and FIRES. Chill DROPS Bruce STOPS in his tracks. Reporters DIVE for cover- COPS jump on the Blonde Reporter, pinning her... Bruce. Fifteen feet away. Loaded gun up his sleeve. Face uncomprehending as the night Chill killed his parents. Rachel moves to Bruce, pulling him away from the chaos. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 CONTINUED: (2) 27.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Come one, Bruce. Come on, we don’t need to see this. Bruce yanks his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I do. INT. RACHEL’S CAR -- EVENING 47 Rachel drives. Bruce sits there, hands in his lap. Starin Rachel glances over at him. Then pulls over. Turns to him

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (gentle) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (distant) All these years I wanted to kill him. Now he’s gone. Now I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don’t mean that.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (bitter) What if I do, Rachel? Chill killed my parents. They deserved justice. Rachel looks at him, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You’re not talking about justice, you’re talking about revenge.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sometimes they’re the same.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They’re never the same, Bruce. Justice is about harmony... revenge is about you making yourself feel better. That’s why we have an impartial system- Rachel pulls out into the street.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Well, your system of justice is broken- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 49 CONTINUED: (2) 28.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don’t you tell me the system’s broken, Bruce! I’m out here every day trying to fix it while you mope around using your grief as an excuse to do nothing. You care about justice. .? Rachel YANKS the wheel-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel’s car SCREECHES across two lanes, onto an EXIT RAM INT./EXT. RACHEL’S CAR ON SURFACE STREETS -- CONTINUOUS 4 The streets below are DARK, crowded and THREATENING-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Look beyond your own pain, Bruce. Rachel gestures at the filthy streets. Down dark alleys- shadowy figures conduct business. RACHEL (CONT’D) This city is rotting. Chill is not the cause, he’s the effect. Corruption is killing Gotham and Chill being dead doesn’t help that- it makes it worse because Falcone walks. He carries on flooding our city with crime and drugs... creating new Joe Chills... Falcone may not have killed your parents, Bruce, but he’s destroying everything they stood for... They pull up in front of a BASEMENT CLUB. RACHEL (CONT’D) They all know where to find Falcone... (gestures at club) But no one will touch him because he keeps the bad people rich and the good people scared. Rachel turns on Bruce. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 CONTINUED: (2) 29. RACHEL (CONT’D) (quiet ) And what chance does Gotham have when the good people do nothing? She pokes him in the chest. Bruce looks down at her finge

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I’m not one of your "good people" Rachel. Chill took that from me. Rachel looks at Bruce strangely.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Bruce pulls up his sleeve. Turns his hand over. Rachel stares at the GUN in his hand, SHOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I was going to kill him myself. She looks at Bruce. Then SLAPS him. Bruce does nothing. Rachel SLAPS him again and again... Nothing. She stops. Tears flowing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You’re no better than the rest. Rachel points at the gun. Looks into Bruce’s eyes. RACHEL (CONT’D) Your father would be ashamed of you. Bruce stares at Rachel. Opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce watches Rachel’s car disappear. Turns to look at th line of SHIPS in the harbor. He makes his way to the wate Takes out his gun. Turns it, STUDIES the light off its metal- INSERT CUT: the TREMBLING BARREL of Chill’s gun, inches f Thomas Wayne’s chest. Bruce, with contempt, FLINGS his gun into the black water  51 52 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce walks towards the entrance. A BOUNCER steps out, looking at him with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Get lost, kid. Bruce pulls a massive wad of cash from his pocket. Splits in two. Offers one half.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: The other half when you give me the nod that Falcone’s leaving. Unawares. The Bouncer looks at Bruce. Takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce watches the entrance from the shadows. Two THUGS escort a thickset man out of a club. The Bouncer waves-

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: "Night, Mr.Falcone. The three men move towards a waiting limo- WHAM- one Thug takes a kick to the head, goes down- Bruce steps from the shadows- the Second Thug goes for his gun- Bruce GRABS his arm- CHOPS his throat- JUDO FLIPS the thug... Bruce turns to Falcone who looks at him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: The little rich kid. No gun? I’m insulted. The First Thug lunges at Bruce with a KNIFE- Bruce puts h down with a graceful SWEEP-

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I don’t need a gun.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Yes, you do. CLICK. A gun is at Bruce’s head. Held by the Bouncer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FALCONE (CONT’D) Money isn’t power down here- fear is. The Bouncer pistol whips him once, hard. Bruce goes down. The Bouncer drops Bruce’s money onto him. FALCONE (CONT’D) You shoulda just sent me a thank-you note... Bruce looks up at Falcone. Spits blood.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I didn’t come here to thank-you. I came to show you that not everyone in Gotham is afraid of you.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Just those that know me. You got balls, kid... (cold) But you don’t belong down here with us. We don’t play fair. Now go back to your big house, wrap yourself in your silk sheets and I’1l send you a shoulder to cry on.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You don’t dress well enough to be a pimp. Falcone lights a cigar. Stares down at bruce. Ice.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: You miss your Mommy and Daddy? Come down here again, I send you to them. Falcone turns. His thugs get into the limo with him. Bruc watches it slide into the night. Struggles to his feet... Bruce walks the docks, wiping blood from his mouth. SHADO in doorways mark his progress. Three YOUTHS approach. Bru stiffens, but they cross the street to avoid him.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No one’1l mess with ya. Bruce turns. A HOMELESS MAN warming at a flaming oil drum One of many HOMELESS clustered around the docks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Wander ‘round here dressed like that, means you got something to prove. Man with something to prove is dangerous. Bruce STARES at the man. Thinking. Takes out his wallet. Removes the money. Hands it to the Homeless Man. HOMELESS MAN (CONT’D) For what?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Your jacket. Bruce DROPS his wallet into the fire. The Homeless Man LAUGHS. Bruce pulls off his tie, throws it into the fire. pulls off his overcoat, bundles it up ready to-

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Lemme have it, that’s a good coat. Bruce looks at the Homeless Man, who has removed his own. They EXCHANGE clothing.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Be careful who sees you with that. (off look) They’re gonna come looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: who? Bruce smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Everyone. Bruce, less incongruous in his "new" coat, moves down towards the stacks of containers... Bruce wanders the stacks. A HORN sounds. Bruce’s eyes loc onto the ship preparing to leave. Bruce runs towards it trough the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And when you left Gotham... And we are-  33.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: ...what were you seeking? Ducard LEAPS up onto a STONE WALL. GRABBING ON using pike on his palms and on his feet. Wayne watches.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: To lose myself. I couldn’t do anything as Bruce Wayne. I felt useless. Ducard gestures up to the top of the 50-ft wall.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Perhaps you can beat my record. Bruce JUMPS up onto the wall, HIGHER than Ducard. Confide

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Two days. (off look) The test is not to see how quickly you can climb, but how slowly. The Ninja is thought invisible, but invisibility is largely a matter of patience. Ducard reaches up for another handhold. Slowly. DUCARD (CONT’D) On your journey... you sought knowledge of the criminal world?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (nods) I needed to understand the thoughts and feelings of those who stand in the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The first time you’re forced to steal not to starve...  55 56 34. Bruce picks up a mango from a stack to examine it. As he does so he uses his lower hand to slip a PLUM into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce squats in a doorway. Bites hungrily into his plum. looks up. A CHILD in rags sits in the next doorway, STARI Bruce stares back, juice dripping.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...you lose many assumptions about the simple nature of right and wrong. Bruce hands the Child the plum. Licks his fingers. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce (bearded, filthy) in a crowd, with an ELDERLY MAN.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I needed to feel the fear before a crime... The Elderly Man SPOTS a BUSINESSMAN hurrying along- STEPS into his path, engineering a COLLISION, tumbling to the pavement. The Businessman and Bruce both CROUCH to help.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And the thrill of success... Bruce SLIPS the Businessman’s wallet out of his pocket. T Businessman moves off. Bruce shows the Elderly Man the wallet for APPROVAL. Then HURRIES after the Businessman.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...without becoming one of them. Bruce CATCHES the Businessman, gives him the wallet. The Businessman thanks Bruce- noticing his destitution, he HA Bruce a banknote. Bruce nods thanks. 31.  57 58 59 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce tries to crack a safe under the supervision of a YO TOUGH. The Young Tough shakes his head, spins the dial an whips open the safe. Showing Wayne the action.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I thought I would find something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a table with a CHINESE BOSS and SEVEN CRIMINALS drinki laughing, showing each other their spoils (watches, phone

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I thought I would learn what I needed to do with my skills and my anger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCK races through the door. Two Criminals yank the do shut after. Bruce and the Boss jumps down from the cab.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: But the harder I looked the less I saw. The less I knew... Bruce turns to the Boss wary.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Where’s this friend of yours? Boss (shrugs) Not friend. Friend of friend. Bruce rolls his eyes. Looks at the Boss with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Until I wasn’t even sure what I’d been looking for in the first place... The doors EXPLODE COPS burst in, shouting in Mandarin.  60 61 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the truck is opened. Cops inventory piles of BOXES pulled out of the back.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And I was lost. Bruce sits in a line of criminals, hands cuffed behind ba A Cop YANKS him to his feet, hauling him over to an OFFIC CoP (in Mandarin) He refuses to give his name. The Officer smiles solicitously at Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin) Fool- this is China, you’re a criminal, what the hell do I care what your name is?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (in fluent Mandarin) I’m not a criminal. The Officer, surprised, waves Bruce away. Looks at the truck.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in accented English) Tell that to the guys who owned these! He KICKS a BOX: CLOSE ON the WAYNE INDUSTRIES logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and Ducard cling to the wall just short of the roof eyes LOCKED. Both are in AGONY, sweat-drenched, STRAINING Ducard BLINKS. REACHES for the roof and pulls himself up. Wayne closes his eyes in relief. Ducard pulls Wayne up on the roof. They lie there in the half-light. Ducard turns Wayne. Puts a hand on his shoulder. Proud.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: You are ready.  62 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Wayne’s BLUE POPPY- now SHRIVELED DRY- on the altar. Wayne, clad in black ninja uniform watches as Duca also in black, picks it up, takes a pestle and mortar, dr in the dried flower, and grinds it to dust. Ducard pours the dust into a small brazier. Lights it. Motions to Wayne, who approaches the smoking altar.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Drink in your fears. Face them. Wayne breathes the smoke. He shakes his head, REACTING to the effects of the smoke... his mind is plagued by IMAGES Chill’s trembling gun- Young Bruce FALLING- Thomas

dialogues.speaker: STAGGERING-
dialogues.text: Ducard puts on his ninja mask. Motions Wayne to do the sa Wayne STRUGGLES to think through the effects of the smoke

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Why The masks? As if in reply, DOZENS of NINJAS step forward from the shadows: the hall is filled with identical Ninjas. Ducard has melted into the crowd. Wayne raises his guard...

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: To conquer fear, you must become fear... you must bask in the fear of other men... and men fear most what they cannot see- Ducard STRIKES at Wayne- Wayne SPINS, PARRIES- but Ducard has gone. The Ninjas movie in unison, forming WALLS... DUCARD (CONT’D) It is not enough to be a man... you have to become an idea... a terrible thought... a wraith- The Ninja nearest Wayne TURNS and SLASHES- it is Ducard. Wayne LEAPS sideways, ROLLING through the wall of Ninjas. looks at his arm- it has been slashed, the uniform torn a dead giveaway. Wayne looks around, crouched, READY... One wall of Ninjas PARTS, revealing a WOODEN BOX. Wayne stares at it, MIND SPINNING from the smoke. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Face your fear... Wayne cautiously approaches the box. Carefully lifts the lid. PEERS inside... BATS EXPLODE from the box, FILLING the air- Wayne dives a from the box, STARING up at the squawking bats- flinching Ducard LEAPS at Wayne, who ROLLS sideways, blocking- Wayn turns to face Ducard, but he is lost in the Ninjas, bats filling the air, Wayne FLINCHING with their attacks... Wayne stays low, SLASHES the arm of the Ninja nearest him the man does not move. Wayne turns. Fighting to THINK. A Ninja paces softly through the crowd, as he speaks, we tell this is Ducard...

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Become one with the darkness... Ducard falls in behinds a Ninja with a SLASHED SLEEVE... KNOCKS him to his knees, sword against throat- DUCARD (CONT’D) You cannot leave any sign... Ducard pulls off his own mask. Disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I haven't. A SWORD IS AT DUCARD’S NECK- Wayne is behind him, pulling off his mask. Ducard looks around... several of the Ninja around them have slashed sleeves. Ducard smiles. The Ninjas TURN, in unison, and sit. Ra’s Al Ghul is seated on a small stage at the head of th room. Ducard leads Wayne to sit down in front of Ra’s. A Ninja places a tray between them: a bottle and a burning candle. Ducard places the candle in front of Wayne and ha him a small glass. Ra’s Al Ghul begins speaking in Urdu.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: We have purged your fear. You are ready to lead these men. You are ready to become a member of the League of Shadows. Drink. Wayne tips back the glass. Strong stuff. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUCARD (CONT’D) By blowing out this candle you renounce your mortal life. You renounce forever the cities of man. You dedicate your life to solitude. Wayne leans forward to blow out the candle. PAUSES. Looks the rows of seated Ninjas.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Where will I be leading these men?

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: You will need them in Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You want me to go back to Gotham? Ra’s stares at Wayne. Starts speaking...

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: You yourself are a victim of Gotham’s decay. That is why you came here, and that is why you must go back. You will assume the mantle of your birthright. As Gotham’s favored son you will be ideally placed...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: To help us destroy the city.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: When Gotham falls, the other cities will follow in short order. Nature’s balance will be restored and Man will finally return to solitude. Wayne turns to Ducard.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You can’t believe in this. Ducard looks at Wayne, troubled. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 CONTINUED: (4) 40.

dialogues.speaker: DUCARD
dialogues.text: Ra’s Al Ghul has rescued you from the darkest corner of your own heart... what he asks in return is obedience. And the courage to do what is necessary. Wayne stares down at the flickering candle. At the bottle Wayne FLICKS his sword out, SMASHING the bottle, TIPPING candle- FLAMES spread across the wooden floor- DUCARD (CONT’D) (reaching to extinguish flames) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What’s necessary. Wayne STRIKES Ducard in the head with the butt of his swo DOUSES his mask in the liquid fire and TOSSES it back int the mezzanine where the explosive powders are stored... Ra’s LEAPS from his throne, STRIKING at Wayne with his sword- Wayne parries- EXPLOSIONS roar from the balcony, shooting flame across the ceiling- Ra’s and Wayne fight a EXPLOSIONS surround them... Wayne LEAPS clear as FLAMING DEBRIS collapses onto Ra’s, CRUSHING him... the flames are rising, Ninja bodies are strewn around, fresh explosions rip across the hall as Ninjas flee and Wayne spots Ducard lying unconscious. Wayne PICKS UP Ducard, hauls him out of the Throne room, into a passage, SMASHING THROUGH an ornate screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and Ducard CRASH down onto a steep slope of ice and rock, the monastery exploding above them... Wayne rolls over, GRABS a rock, looks across to see- Ducard UNCONSCIOUS, SLIDING down the icy slope. His limp form ROTATES, spinning as his body gathers MOMENTUM, rush towards the EDGE of the CLIFF... Wayne DIVES AFTER HIM, SLIDING HEAD-FIRST down the ice... the cliff closer and closer as Wayne RACES after Ducard..  64 65 66 67 41. MERE FEET FROM THE CLIFF EDGE, Wayne GRABS Ducard- raises his free GAUNTLET-CLAD ARM, and SMASHES AT THE ICE, DIGGI IN with the BRONZE SCALLOPS... STOPPING on the edge- Duca HANGS LIMPLY over a tremendous drop- Wayne STRUGGLES with the dead weight. Wayne PULLS Ducard up onto the ice. BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne CARRIES Ducard down the road. INT. SHERPA’S HUT -- MOMENTS LATER 65 Wayne KICKS the door open. The Old Man he saw on his way the mountain stares back at him. Then motions Wayne to pu Ducard down onto some mats. The Old Man wipes blood from Ducard’s temple. Looks at Wayne, who is moving to the door...

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I will tell him you saved his life. Wayne stops. Turns. Looks back at Ducard.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Tell him... I have an ailing ancestor who needs me. Wayne puts his hands together in formal salute. Bows. INT. CLIMBER’S BAR, BHUTAN -- DAY 66 A smoky inn, full of SHERPAS and CLIMBERS. Wayne enters, FILTHY, RAGGED. Conversation CEASES. Everyone STARES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne uses a phone at the bar, waiting for an answer-

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wayne residence. Wayne SMILES at Alfred’s familiar voice.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Alfred. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (unflappable) Master Wayne. It’s been some time.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes it has. I need a ride.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: And where are we, sir? Wayne glances around.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Bhutan, I think. A curious Sherpa nearby NODS at Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Am I to assume that you’re without money and passport?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m traveling a bit light, yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I believe there’s an airstrip at Khatmandu long enough for a G5. Make your way there, I’1l have the jet down in fifteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Very good. Oh, and Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Bring some painkillers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne steps out of the washroom, clean-shaven, fresh tailored clothes. The jet breaks cloud, revealing GOTHAM bathed in glorious SUNRISE. Wayne looks out at the city. Alfred, sleeping opposite, opens an eye.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Have you told anyone I’m coming home? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 70 71 CONTINUED: (2) 43.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I thought you might like to surprise a few people.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: No one can know I’m back. Not until I’m ready. I’1l need everything on the company- shareholders’ reports, holdings. Everything. Alfred SMILES to himself. Closes his eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: You sound like a man with purpose. Wayne stares at the vast city beneath them as the jet BAN

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Gotham needs me, Alfred. Gotham needs... a symbol.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: What symbol, sir?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Something for the good to rally behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING over SPIRES of the city catching GOLD of first lig

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...and the criminals to fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, cross-legged on the floor, STUDIES a thick report. Circles something, closes it. Draws another from a STACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred makes tea. A television plays: business news.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: (over television) Lot of interest in new directions Wayne Industries has been taking... Alfred looks up: Earle is being interviewed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 74 75 CONTINUED: (2) 44. INTERVIEWER (CONT’D) ...couple big defense contracts in the bag... as well as rumors that the board is petitioning to have Bruce Wayne, missing for seven years now, declared officially dead.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: (smiles thinly) Our operating assumption is always the hopeful one that Bruce’1l resurface sometime soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne HEARS a CHITTERING. He rises, moving out into the m hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne STARES: a small shadow SPUTTERS around the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A blessed bat gain, sir. Wayne turns to find Alfred standing there with a tea service.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: They nest somewhere on the grounds. Wayne watches the dark shape FLICKER around the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne walks across the gardens to the greenhouse. He wear long overcoat, a coil of rope over one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now derelict. Glass cracked or missing, paint peeled from wrought iron. Wayne stands in the entrance, remembering- INSERT CUT: Rachel, LAUGHING, SPRINTING between the table  76 77 78 79 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS, punctured by LIGHT as BOARDS are YANKED, splintering from the mouth of the well, high above. Wayne LOWERS himself down the shaft, overcoat billowing. undoes his rope at the bottom. TURNS, finding- The DARK CREVICE between the rocks. Wayne CROUCHES, pushi into the BLACKNESS, crawling through into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne climbs down a jagged rock crevice. Air blows in his face. The crevice WIDENS into a low-ceilinged chamber. Wa hears the RUSH of WATER. He crouches, advances through th low chamber. It turns DOWNWARDS, steeper- Wayne carefully slides on his back, LOWERING HIMSELF into... LIMITLESS BLACK. Wayne stands. A ROAR of water now. He REACHES into his coat, pulls out a CHEMICAL TORCH. CRACKS it, throwing LIGHT into... A VAST CAVERN. An underground RIVER, a JAGGED ceiling, fa above, which, as Wayne PEERS, starts to MOVE- BATS EXPLODE from the ceiling. THOUSANDS DESCEND, SCREECHING, attracted to the light- Wayne instinctively CROUCHES. But as they SWARM around him terrifyingly... Wayne RISES to his feet amidst a CYCLONE of bats, watchin the fluttering blackness with a profound CALM. And he knows the symbol he must use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne stares at the DECAY. Sadness gives way to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rolls pulls up onto the Plaza in front of Wayne Stati The station is deserted. Derelict. Wayne gets out, starin

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Is it closed?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: They still run a token service out of respect for your father. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 82 CONTINUED: (2) 46.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (low) Respect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A board meeting in full swing. Earle presiding. He is addressing a portly, distinguished man at the other end. This is JUDGE PHELAN.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Clearly, Judge Phelan, moving to have Bruce declared dead is not something that any of us here relishes... but as responsible managers it falls to us to act on behalf of Wayne Industries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne walks past the young, beautiful ASSISTANT sat her desk.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Morning. The Assistant gets to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Sir, you can’t go in there! Wayne turns to her. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yes, I can. The Assistant RECOGNIZES him, stands there, SHOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door OPENS, Earle looks over, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, can I...? Earle STARES. Dumbstruck. All heads TURN- Wayne smiles.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Sorry to barge in, but I was in the areas... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. Earle gets to his feet, approaching Wayne, STARI He SHAKES Wayne’s hand, claps the other on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: My boy! We thought you were gone for good.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What can I say? "Reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated". Nervous chuckles. Judge Phelan stares at Wayne, incredulo

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Can I ask where you’ve been?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (mischievous ) You can ask...

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Well, perhaps you’11 tell us your plans. Are you back to finish college?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Actually, I thought I’d get to grips with what we actually do around here. From the ground up- one division at a time. Earle takes this in, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Any idea where you’d like to start?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Applied sciences caught my eye.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Mr.Fox’s department. I’1l make a call. You can start today.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Actually, I’ve got a one o’clock tee-off, and it took me all morning to convince the club to honor my old membership. (grins at Earle) Apparently they don’t have to meet the same high standards as you when it comes to declaring someone dead.  48. 83 INT. STAIRCASE, DISTRICT ATTORNEY’S OFFICE -- DAY 83 Rachel HURRIES down marble stairs to catch Finch.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mr.Finch.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (weary) Yes, Miss Dodson?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mr.Finch, on the Falcone matter-

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (here we go again) The case against Falcone died with Chill. We had our shot. They walk out into the parking lot...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That was then- but now he’s importing drugs, everybody knows it, let’s take it to Harvey Dent and-

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (looking around) Keep your voice down. (quite, sympathetic) Look, Rachel, Falcone’s got Judge Phelan and half of City Hall bought and paid for. So you got burned on Falcone- let it go, we’ve got bigger fish to fry.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That would make a lot more sense if we were doing any frying. Finch, uncomfortable, TURNS. Rachel WATCHES him exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat, Wayne WATCHES Rachel standing there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 CONTINUED: (2) 49.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Shall I park, sir? Wayne wrestles for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: No, let’s go. Alfred pulls out with a touch of disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive WAREHOUSE, stacked with crates, odd-shaped unde dust covers, lab equipment. LUCIUS FOX, aged 52, leads Wa through the stacks, speaking in calm, knowledgeable tones

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Environmental applications, defense projects, consumer products... all prototypes, none if production at any level whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: None? Fox pauses, turns to Wayne, a wicked gleam in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: What did they tell you this place was?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: They didn’t tell me anything.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: They told me exactly what it was when they sent me here... a dead end where I couldn’t cause any more trouble for the rest of the board.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You were on the board?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Back when your father ran things.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You knew my father?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Sure. Helped him build his train. Beautiful project- routed right (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOX (CONT’D) into Wayne Tower, along with the water and power utilities. Made Wayne Tower the unofficial heart of Gotham. Fox stops at a tall CRATE. Checks paperwork. Opens the crate: a BODYSUIT- clear silicone over jointed armor. FOX (CONT’D) Here it is: the nomex survival suit for advanced infantry. Kevlar biweave, reinforced joints... Wayne feels the fabric of the suit.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Bullet -proof?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Anything but a straight shot.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Tear-resistant? Fox HACKS at the suit with his pen- it doesn’t even mark.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: This sucker’1ll stop a knife.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t they put it into production?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: The bean counters figured a soldier’s life wasn’t worth the 300 grand. Fox looks at Wayne. Suspicious. FOX (CONT’D) What do you want with it, Mr.Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I want to borrow it. For spelunking. (off look) You know, cave-diving. Fox shrugs. Puts the lid back on the crate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 CONTINUED: (3) 51.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: You get a lot of gunfire down in those caves?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Listen, I’d rather Mr.Earle didn’t know about me borrowing-

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Mr.Wayne, the way I see it... Fox waves his arm, taking in the enormous facility. FOX (CONT’D) All this stuff is yours, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, high on the cavern wall, in climbing harness, HAMM a bracket into the rock securing a line of industrial LAM

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Okay! Give it a try. Alfred throws a switch on a portable GENERATOR: the lamps flicker on, dimly lighting the length of one wall. Alfred peers at the DAMP, DINGY surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Oh, charming. Alfred sees the BATS covering the entire ceiling. ALFRED (CONT’D) At least you’1l have company. Wayne RAPPELS to the cave floor, looks up to a HIGH corne CRUMBLING BRICKWORK. Alfred follows his gaze. ALFRED (CONT’D) Must be the lowest foundations of the Southeast wing. Wayne CLIMBS up: poking through the rock ceiling: the bot of a wrought-iron SPIRAL STAIRCASE. In the center of the spiral: a dumb-waiter lift, fallen off its track. Wayne grabs the chains of the lift, RATTLES them- sending a wav ECHOING up into the darkness. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 CONTINUED: (2) 52. ALFRED (CONT’D) During the civil war your greatgrandfather was involved with the underground railroad. Secretly transporting freed slaves to the North. I suspect these caverns came in handy. Wayne jumps down. Moves to the small river. Follows it wh it disappears under rocks. Steps over. Alfred waits. The ROAR of WATER gets louder and the light gets BRIGHTER. Wa follows the tunnel around a dog leg, emerging... BEHIND THE FACE OF A WATERFALL. Wayne grins, HOPS along slick rocks right up to the beautiful CURTAIN of water.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (awe) Alfred, come up here. Alfred is twenty feet behind on the dry rocks.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I can see it very well from here, thank-you, sir. Wayne, mesmerized, reaches for water that is liquid light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon, now 46 and a Detective, in the passenger seat. Wo eyes watching his partner, FLASS, 42, glad-hand the owner the liquor store they are parked outside. Flass squeezes into the driving seat holding a wad of CASH.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: Don’t s’pose you want a taste? Gordon looks at Flass, cold. Flass shrugs. Counts his mon FLASS (CONT’D) I keep offering ‘cause who knows, maybe one day you’1l get wise.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Nothing wise in what you do, Flass.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, Jimbo, you don’t take your taste- makes us guys nervous you might decide to roll over- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (irritated) I’m no rat, Flass. (calmer ) In a town this bent, who’s there to rat to, anyway? Flass LAUGHS at this, hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving in on a rooftop balustrade to discover Wayne, wear the bodysuit, crouched, watching the police station acros the street. He pulls on a black balaclava. CLIMBS through the SHADOWS using Ninja SPIRES on his hands and feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon slams the car door. Watches Flass pull away. Weary 91 INT. GORDON’S OFFICE -- CONTINUOUS 91 Gordon SLUMPS into his chair, back to the window. Reaches for the phone- notices a BOOK sitting on his desk: an old worn copy of: "PHYLUM PERACOPDA: THE TWILIGHT WORLD OF BATS". Gordon frowns at the book, CONFUSED. The light goes OUT.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t turn around. Gordon FREEZES- Wayne is behind his, pressing a stapler between Gordon’s shoulder blades as if it were a gun.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’ve been watching. You’re a good cop. One of the few. What would it take to get Falcone? Gordon narrows his eyes, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Carmine Falcone? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 93 CONTINUED: (2) 54.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: He brings in shipments of drugs every week, nobody takes him down. Why?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: He’s paid up with the right people.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What would it take?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Leverage on Judge Phelan. And a D.A. brave enough to prosecute.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Rachel Dodson in the D.A.’s office.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Watch for a sign.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You’re just one man?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Now we are two.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Wwe? No response. Gordon turns around. No one. He JUMPS to the window- looks down, looks up: a SHADOW slips onto the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon RACES across the bullpen, drawing his gun, hits th stairwell- two UNIFORMS see him go, run after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne moves to the edge of the roof- the gap is TOO BIG- TURNS BACK- the DOOR SMASHES open: Gordon GUN RAISED.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
dialogues.text: Wayne RACES for the GAP- LEAPS... DROPS FAST... misses TH TOP STORY- GRABS the balcony below... it BREAKS AWAY- DRO him onto the one below. Winded, Wayne CLIMBS onto the wal (CONTINUED)
From the other roof, Gordon watches Wayne melt into the shadows. The Uniforms arrive either side.

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORM 1
dialogues.text: The hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Some nut. But Gordon’s expression is less certain. INT. EARLE’S OFFICE, WAYNE TOWER -- DAY 94 Earle sits at his desk conferring with two board members.

dialogues.speaker: BOARD MEMBER
dialogues.text: Is he taking over?

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Not yet. I checked the trust, and Bruce can’t assume control until his thirtieth birthday. (presses intercom) Jessica, where’s that coffee?

dialogues.speaker: BOARD MEMBER
dialogues.text: But that’s in three months.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: We’1l have to move fast.

dialogues.speaker: BOARD MEMBER 2
dialogues.text: To do what?

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: An IPO. There’s nothing in Bruce’s trust to stop us taking the company public... we’ll have an offering...

dialogues.speaker: BOARD MEMBER
dialogues.text: (getting it) And Bruce will become just another board member.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Precisely. We can’t have some clown prince running things. (presses intercom) Jessica? No answer. Earle steps to the door and opens it. His assistant is GONE. So is the receptionist.  95 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWISH-CLICK of a Titleist rocketing off the roof and towards Gotham River. Wayne stands behind the Beautiful Assistant, hand on her hip, adjusting her grip on a gold club. Another YOUNG WOMAN watches, leaning on a driver.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Keep your elbows in...

dialogues.speaker: EARLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies? They turn. Earle is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr.Earle, Mr.Wayne insisted that all junior executives need to know how to play golf.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Junior Executive? Who’s answering the phones? Wayne smiles pleasantly at Earle.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: This is Wayne Industries, Mr.Earle- I’m sure they’1l call back. Wayne unwraps himself from Jessica and approaches Earle. WAYNE (CONT’D) (conspiratorial) I thought a few promotions might be good karma forgetting my new job. Earle smiles patiently.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Of course, you’re not actually starting just yet, Bruce. Not until your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (grins) Three month’s time- I’m having a huge blowout and I expect everyone to be there.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: With bells on. How are things down at Applied Sciences? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Great- there’s some cool stuff down there. Although that Mr.Fox goes on a bit once you get him talking. Earle takes Wayne by the elbow, walking him away.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: Since you’re here, there is a business matter that I wanted to make you aware of... Wayne assumes a pose of seriousness.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Business... sure.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: We’ve been thinking for some time about offering shares... I think the time is right.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Offering shares?

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: It’s just a way of raising capital for growth... it’s important to me that the company be in great shape when you take over. Consider it my legacy. Wayne nods. EARLE (CONT’D) Well, I guess I’d better go hire a new secretary and receptionist... Earle head to the door. Wayne smiles, turns back to Jessi

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Right, who’s turn is it? 96 EXT. FALCONE’S BASEMENT CLUB, DOCK AREA -- NIGHT 96 Judge Phelan exits the club, a GIRL on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Night, Judge Phelan. Phelan turns, giddy with drink, puts his finger to his li (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 98 CONTINUED: (2) 58.

dialogues.speaker: PHELAN
dialogues.text: Shhhhh. The Girl giggles. Phelan guides her into a waiting limo. STREET PERSON comes over to the rear windows of the car knocking. The DRIVER gets out.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Get lost! The Driver KICKS the Street Person away from the limo. A Homeless Man warming by a fire starts shouting. It is the Homeless Man that Bruce gave his coat to years before. Th coat is worn but recognizable.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Leave him alone! Let him be! The limo moves off. Close on the Street Person watching i leave. IT IS BRUCE. He glances down at a tiny CAMERA in h lap. Smiles at the screen: Phelan and the Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne places two BRONZE GAUNTLETS on a trestle table. FIR up a paint sprayer. Starts coating them matte BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne is showing Alfred DIAGRAMS. We catch only GLIMPSES.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: If we order the main part of this... (points) ...cowl from Singapore-

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Via a shell corporation.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Indeed. Then quite separately, place an order through a Chinese manufacturer for these- Alfred points at a diagram which looks like a pair of HOR

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (nods) Put it together ourselves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 CONTINUED: (2) 59.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Precisely. Of course, they’1ll have to be large orders to avoid suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: How large?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Say, ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Least we’1ll have spares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox, at his desk, watches Wayne approaching.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: (smiles) What’s it today? More "spelunking"?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Sper-lunking. And no, today it’s base-jumping.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Base-jumping? What, like parachuting?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I need some kind of lightweight grappling hook...

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
