dialogues.text: Base jumping’s illegal-you can’t just take the elevator. Fox shakes his head at Wayne. Gets to his feet. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: We’ve got suction pads, grapples...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Any good? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 CONTINUED: (2) 60.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Nope. But this thing’s pretty neat. Fox pulls out a box. Inside: a bronze GRAPPLING GUN and HARNESS. FOX (CONT’D) Pneumatic. Magnetic grapple. Monofilament tested to 350 pounds. Wayne feels the weight. It is light. Strong. He picks up HARNESS that goes with it. Shoulder straps with a wide, hi-tech BELT. Wayne shoves the back end of the gun into t belt buckle- it CLICKS into place.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Too expensive for the army? Fox takes it back from Wayne. Sardonic.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Guess they never thought about marketing to the billionaire base-jumping, spelunking market.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Look, Mr.Fox, if you’re uncomfortable-

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Mr.Wayne, if you don’t tell me what you’re really doing, then when I get asked... I don’t have to lie. But don’t treat me like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (nods) Fair enough. Fox looks at Wayne. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Come on, I’1l show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox hands Wayne a sheet of black fabric.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Notice anything? Wayne examines it, shrugs. Fox puts on a GLOVE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 CONTINUED: (2) 61. FOX (CONT’D) Memory fabric- dual layer polymers with variable alignment molecules. Flexible ordinarily, but put a current through it... Fox GRABS the fabric- which instantly POPS into the RIGID shape of a small one-man TENT. Wayne raises his eyebrows. FOX (CONT’D) ...the molecules align and become rigid. Wayne pushes on the tent, feeling its strength, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What kind of shapes can you make? Fox releases the tent, which instantly COLLAPSES.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: It could be tailored to any structure based on a rigid skeleton. Wayne lifts the black fabric, FLICKING it in a WHIPPING motion. Thinking. Then he sees something. Some kind of vehicle, covered by a tarp. HUGE TIRES visible.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What’s that? Fox, a twinkle in his eye, rolls up the memory fabric.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: The Tumbler? Oh, you wouldn’t be interested in that. Wayne shoots Fox a look, and we

dialogues.speaker: ON TEST TRACK
dialogues.text: Wayne pilots using aircraft-like control sticks. Fox, in passenger seat, hangs on as Wayne PUSHES the vehicle... The Tumbler SHOOTS PAST: LOW and WIDE, a cross between a Lamborghini Countach and a Humvee. Sandy camouflage, stealthangled panelling and variable-angle flaps across t back. Fox SHOUTS over the noise of the engine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: She was built as a bridging vehicle! You hit that button- (Wayne reaches)

dialogues.speaker: NO, NOT NOW
dialogues.text: (Wayne recoils) It boosts her into a rampless jump! In combat, two of them jump a river towing cables, then you run a bailey bridge across! Damn bridge never worked- but this baby works fine! Wayne inspects the cockpit: a forward-slung "gunner’s" driving position between their legs, video screens, electronic controls, windows with HEADS-UP DISPLAY. Wayne ACCELERATES... The Tumbler TEARS down the straightaway, SKIDS to a HALT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox JOLTS with the stop. Turns to Wayne, a little green.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: What do you think? Wayne turns to Fox with a slight smile.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Does it come in black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne takes the hi-tech harness for the grapple and CUTS the shoulder straps, leaving a BELT WITH SLIDING ATTACHMENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne lifts a GLOVED hand, metal contacts on the fingerti With his other hand, he picks up a FABRIC GLOVE, RIBBONS dangling from each finger. He thrusts the gloved hand int the fabric glove- the ribbons SHOOT OUT- RIGID FINGER EXTENSIONS like the SKELETON of a BAT’S WING. Wayne FANS PROJECTIONS, testing.  105 106 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on: the COWL. Black, with a slight GRAPHITE sheen. Dramatic, ICONIC even without its ears. A BASEBALL BAT SMASHES into the crown, CRACKING it in two Alfred picks the pieces off the table, FROWNING.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Problems with the graphite mixture, apparently. The next ten thousand will be up to specifications. Wayne looks up from adjusting a servo-mounted microphone.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: At least they gave us a discount.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Quite. In the meantime, might I suggest, sir, that you try to avoid landing on your head? Wayne shoots Alfred a look. Then fits the microphone into the horn-shaped "ear" from the cowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne GRINDS METAL at a lathe. Alfred approaches with a thermos. Wayne stops grinding, BLOWS on his handiwork...

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Why the design, Master Wayne? Alfred indicates the steel carved into a BAT’S WING.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: A man, however strong, however skilled, is just flesh and blood. I need to be more than a man. I need to be a symbol.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: And why the symbol of the bat?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Bats frighten me. (slight smile) And it’s time my enemies shared my dread. Wayne tilts the crude BATARANG, watching light dance acro the brushed steel. He THROWS it WHISTLING into darkness..  107 108 64. INT. FALCONE’S CLUB, DOCK AREA -- NIGHT 107 Judge Phelan sits sandwiched between two GIRLS, drink and cigar in hand. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: PHELAN
dialogues.text: Carmine! Where are you going? Falcone is putting his coat on.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Duty calls. You have yourself a good time, Judge. Falcone turns to the CLUB MANAGER. Leans in. FALCONE (CONT’D) If he’s too cheap to get a hotel, at least make him take his car around to the alley. (shakes his head) No class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the stacks, THUGS unload BOXES an open container. HEADLIGHTS light them up- everyone FREEZES. A sedan pulls up. FLASS emerges. Approaches one of the thugs holding a box. OPENS it, YANKS out a STUFFED TOY.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: Cute. Flass RIPS open the toy, pulls a plastic PACKAGE from inside. FLASS (CONT’D) (mock surprise) Oh? What have we here? Nobody reacts. Flass hands the toy back to the Thug. FLASS (CONT’D) Carry on, gents. Flass heads inside a massive warehouse to a set of office  109 110 111 112 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flass enters. Falcone sits at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: You believe this hump, Flass? He indicates a thin man opposite. Flass sits.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: Problem?

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Crane here’s making insinuations. The thin man, CRANE, leans forward. A cold presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insinuations? Well, let me be clearer- you stepped on the last shipment before you delivered it to me. You cut it with baby powder, and rendered it useless for my purposes. Falcone stares at the slight man, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: (furious) Flass, tell this guy what happens to people who talk to me this way. EXT. FALCONE’S CLUB, DOCK AREA -- CONTINUOUS 110 Judge Phelan stumbles out of the club with the GIRLS. The pile into the waiting limo. The Club Manager gestures to Driver to pull around into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Limo idles in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver picks his ear. The partition is closed. The Driver examines his finger... WHAM!!! A BLACK SHAPE LANDS ON THE HOOD- the Driver’s eye go wide as- SMASH! !!- a BLACK-GLOVED FIST SHATTERS THE WINDSCREEN an GRABS the Driver’s neck... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 114 115 CONTINUED: (2) 66. IN THE BACK: Phelan sits BOLT UPRIGHT. The girls look around, ALARMED.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN.
dialogues.text: Crouched like a dark animal on the hood- the Girls SCREAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Homeless Man looks up from his brazier, curious. He s a dark shape on the hood of a limo, a LONG BLACK CLOAK BILLOWING out behind it... screams echo through the alley

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phelan scrambles back in his seat, whimpering...

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: You have eaten well... As Gotham has starved. Batman’s eyes stare out of the black cowl at Phelan. BATMAN (CONT’D) This changes tonight. Batman SHOOTS UP OFF the hood, banging onto the roof-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Homeless Man STARES OPEN-MOUTHED at Batman standing, ICONIC, on the roof of the limo, cloak billowing... Batma turns his head towards the Homeless Man-

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Nice coat. -and FLIES UP from the limo, DISAPPEARING into the shadow high above... The Homeless Man looks down at his coat, then back up to shadows...

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: (small) Thanks.  116 117 118 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crane looks at Falcone, matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m aware that you’re not intimidated by me, Mr.Falcone. But you know who we’re working for... and when he gets here I don’t think he’s going to want to hear that you’ve been endangering our operation just to filch a few dollars from your dealers.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: He’s coming to Gotham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. This is our last shipment. Falcone shifts, SUDDENLY UNEASY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THUG hands a box to a SECOND THUG, who walks away along the corridor of containers. The first Thug turns back to darkness of the open container, reaches in-

dialogues.speaker: HE IS YANKED INTO THE DARKNESS WITH AN ECHOING CRY-
dialogues.text: Second Thug TURNS, stares uneasily down the deserved corridor to the BLACK MOUTH of the open container...

dialogues.speaker: SECOND THUG
dialogues.text: Steiss? No reply. He puts down his box. Draws his gun. A THIRD TH comes around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD THUG
dialogues.text: Come on, we gotta- He sees the Second Thug’s gun. Draws his own. They move cautiously towards the open container...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs peer into the blackness of the open container -  119 120 68. Behind them, a LAMP hanging above the corridor SHATTERS, Thugs turn, startled, to see another lamp shatter and go dark- them another and another, DARKNESS ADVANCING TOWARD THEM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falcone lifts his hands in a gesture of peace.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: There’s no need to argue- you can just test the stuff here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s why I came. Flass tosses the package onto the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the closest lamp SHATTERS, a GLINT of metal DROPS to t ground... the Second Thug bends, picks it up, STARING; A BAT-SHAPED brushed steel plate. The Second Thug looks u confused, but the Third Thug is STARING above him.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND THUG
dialogues.text: What? The Second Thug looks up himself: a DARK SHAPE HANGING fr a CRANE directly above him... A GIANT BAT, WINGS FOLDED, head pointed towards the groun SECOND THUG (CONT’D) What the hell- The Bat DROPS- wings WHIP OUT, RIGID- CATCH the air- FLIPPING the shape downwards- ENVELOPING THE SECOND THUG DARKNESS- the Third Thug BOLTS, RACING between containers arms PUMPING- He SPRINTS headlong down the narrow corridor, SKIDS aroun corner, RACES towards-

dialogues.speaker: FEET, WHIPPING HIM INTO DARKNESS WITH A PIERCING SCREAM..
Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Thugs REACT to the SCREAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falcone and Crane hear the scream. Flass JUMPS up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thugs, guns drawn, advance into the stacks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Fourth Thug WHIPS around a corner to see a JUMPY THUG covering the other end of the corridor... The Fourth Thug nods, steps backwards. MOVEMENT in the shadow behind him... BATMAN IS ALREADY IN FRAME- his arm FLASHES forward with his CLOAK, WRAPS the Thug’s neck, YA him backwards into the shadows.. Jumpy Thug sees the other Thug DISAPPEAR... he OPENS FIRE STROBING the stacks, revealing INDISTINCT GLIMPSES of MOVEMENT. ELSEWHERE IN THE STACKS: Thugs REACT to the gunfire... Flass stands outside the stacks, gun drawn, listening. He moves back into the office.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?! Flass looks at Falcone.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: You’ve got a problem out there. Falcone reaches behind the desk, PULLS out a SHOTGUN.  126 127 128 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpy Thug FIRES blindly at STROBING SHADOWS- GLIMPSES of DARK CLOAKED FIGURE moving from SHADOW TO SHADOW. Jumpy T empties the clip. FUMBLES for another as he looks out int the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE ARE YOU
dialogues.text: A whispered word at his ear:

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Here. BATMAN’S FACE, UPSIDE DOWN, at the Thug’s shoulder- Jumpy Thug SCREAMS as he is ENGULFED by DARKNESS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flass scuttles over to his car. Crane pauses, listening t the shouts and gunfire. Then moves off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falcone advances through the stacks, shotgun in hand. He rounds a corner to find FIVE THUGS, various weapons in ha in a loose defensive ring, peering out into the darkness. A SHADOW DROPS into the center of their ring- Thugs TURN, SHOUTING, one SWINGS a CHAIN, another a KNIFE -Batman DUCKS the chain- SWEEP-KICKS the knife-wielder to the ground. Chain SWINGS again... Batman JUMPS up, one leg LOW to let the CHAIN WRAP around his ANKLE- Batman KICKS his leg sideways RIPPING the chai from its owner, then HEAD BUTTING him down - Batman SPINS his CHAIN-WRAPPED LEG in a ROUNDHOUSE KICK, WHIPPING THREE THUGS behind him in the fade with the CHAI All three go DOWN. The rest are unconscious or gone. Batman STANDS there, long cape BILLOWING out to one side. The chain SLIDES from his leg. Falcone is behind him, SHOTGUN aimed dead at Batman’s head.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: What in God’s name are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 CONTINUED: (2) 71. Batman opens his hand, revealing TWO SHOTGUN CARTRIDGES. Then TURNS, billowing cape WRAPPING around him.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I’m Batman. Falcone pulls the trigger. CLICK. INT. BEDROOM, RACHEL’S APARTMENT -- LATER 129 Rachel TOSSES, trying to sleep, eyes shut.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rachel Dodson. Rachel bolts upright, GRASPING at her bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Who’s there?!! She pulls out a TASER- PEERS into the shadows: Silhouette by the window- a dark, cloaked figure. Batman. RACHEL (CONT’D) Take one step, I drop you! Batman moves his arm- something DROPS onto Rachel’s bed: FILE, spilling PHOTOS. She FLINCHES. GLANCES DOWN: photos Phelan and the girl in the limo. RACHEL (CONT’D) What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Leverage.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do I need leverage for?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: To get things moving.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Someone like you. Someone who’1ll stand against the corruption. Rachel reaches for the lamp, her eyes off the window for INSTANT it takes to ILLUMINATE the room, revealing- No one.  130 131 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon approaches, coffee in hand: TIED-UP THUGS sit agai the container full of DRUGS. UNIFORMS hold back a line of PRESS, who snap away at the surreal scene. Gordon crouche to look at the Thugs, curious.

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Falcone’s men?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Does it matter? We’1l never tie him to it, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t be too sure of that. Gordon looks up. The uniformed Cop is POINTING. At a HARB LIGHT trained on the heavens. Gordon RISES, walks towards it. Two Cops stand there, STARING: Falcone is STRAPPED to the LIGHT, UNCONSCIOUS, arms sprea Coat RIPPED, hanging from his arms in a STRANGE PATTERN. CoP 1 Th hell is that? Looks like... Gordon follows their gaze up to where the BEAM of light C FALCONE’S SHADOW onto the CLOUDS.

dialogues.speaker: COP 2
dialogues.text: Like a bat. Gordon stares at the projection. It is a BAT SYMBOL.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Cut him down. Gordon moves away, THINKING. Something catches his eye: a block away. Halfway up a building. A BLACK FLAG blowing i the wind... Not a flag.. a DARK FIGURE, wearing a CAPE, sitting on a LEDGE... BATMAN. WATCHING. INT. FINCH’S OFFICE -- MORNING 131 Rachel TOSSES a newspaper onto Finch’s desk, BEAMING. The front page: a huge photo of Falcone strapped to the light

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No way to bury it now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132 CONTINUED: (2) 73.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Maybe so, but there’s Judge Phelan-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’ve got Phelan covered.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: And this "bat" they’re babbling about. Rachel breaks eye contact for an instant, UNCOMFORTABLE.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Even if these guys’1l swear in court to being thrashed by a giant bat... we have Falcone at the scene- drugs, prints, cargo manifest- everything. Finch considers. Grins.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Damn right. Let’s get frying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loeb addresses CAPTAINS, SERGEANTS, LIEUTENANTS. Gordon a the back. Loeb HOLDS up the PAPER, SMACKS the front page.

dialogues.speaker: LOEB
dialogues.text: Unacceptable. I don’t care if it’s rival gangs, Guardian Angels or the goddamn Salvation Army- get them off the street, and off the front page.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN SIMPSON
dialogues.text: They say it was one guy... or thing.

dialogues.speaker: LOEB
dialogues.text: Dipping into their own supply- it was some asshole in a costume. (the room chuckles) If it’s one guy, that’1ll make it a lot easier for you, won’t it? Gordon RAISES his hand. Loeb NODS, cautious.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: This guy did deliver us one of the city’s biggest crime lords. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOEB
dialogues.text: (glares) No one takes the law into their own hands in my city, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred opens the curtains. Wayne WAKES, squinting.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (groggy) Bats are nocturnal.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Bats, maybe... but even for billionaire playboys, 3 o’clock is pushing it. The price of leading a double life, I fear. Alfred PUTS down a tray: water, fruit, newspaper. ALFRED (CONT’D) Your theatrics made an impression.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Theatricality and deception are powerful weapons, Alfred. It’s a start. Wayne glances at the paper. Gets out of bed, bare-chested Alfred sees BRUISES across his torso and arms.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: If those are to be the first of many injuries... it would be wise to find a suitable excuse. Polo, for instance. Wayne throws Alfred a look.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m not learning polo, Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Strange injuries, a nonexistent social life... these things beg the question of what, exactly, Bruce Wayne does with his time. And his money. Wayne considers this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What does someone like me do?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Drive sports cars, date movie stars... Buy things that aren’t for sale. Wayne looks at Alfred. Nods. DOWNS the water, stands straight, feet together- FALLS FORWARD to the floor- into his dizzyingly fast push-ups. Alfred watches. Concerned. ALFRED (CONT’D) Who knows, Master Wayne- if you start pretending to have fun, you might even have a little by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crane, briefcase in hand, is BUZZED through thick steel a glass doors and met inside by a PRISON OFFICIAL. They wal

dialogues.speaker: PRISON OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Dr.Crane, thanks for coming down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. So he cut his wrists?

dialogues.speaker: PRISON OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Probably looking for an insanity plea, but if anything happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, better safe than sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crane enters. Falcone sits at a table, wrist bandaged. Cr places his briefcase on the table. Falcone smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Doctor Crane, it’s all too much, the walls are closing in, blah, blah, blah. Couple more days of this food, it’1l be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: We got a lot to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Such as, how you’re gonna convince me to keep my mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? You don’t know anything.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: I know you wouldn’t want the cops taking a closer look at the drugs they seized. Crane REACTS to this. Falcone SMILES, enjoying the reacti FALCONE (CONT’D) I know about your experiments on the inmates at your nuthouse... (off look) I don’t get into business with someone without finding out their dirty secrets. Those goons you hired.. I own the muscle in this town. Falcone leans forward. Looks Crane in the eye. FALCONE (CONT’D) So what have I been bringing in for you hidden in my drugs, Crane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wanted you to know he’d have told you himself. Falcone shifts slightly.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: I’ve been smuggling your stuff in for months, so whatever he’s got planned, it’s big. And I want it. Crane studies Falcone. Considering. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already know what he’ll say... that we should kill you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falcone leans forward, glaring at Crane with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Even he can’t touch me in here. Not in my town. Crane SHRUGS. Leans forward. Pops the locks on his briefcase. Smiles at Falcone. Crane reaches into his briefcase. Inside is a BREATHING APPARATUS attached to a small BURLAP SACK MASK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see my mask? He pulls the mask out of the case. Holds it up. CRANE (CONT’D) I use it in my experiments. Probably not very frightening to a guy like you. But those crazies... Falcone stares at Crane, uneasy. Crane puts on the mask. is a sack with eye holes and twine stitching for a mouth. CRANE (CONT’D) ...they can’t stand it...

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: When did the nut take over the asylum- WHUMP- a cloud of white SMOKE shoots out of Crane’s briefcase. Falcone pushes his chair back, COUGHING, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scream and cry... Falcone looks up at Crane in his mask- Through Falcone’s eyes: tiny LIZARD TONGUES FLICK out of holes in Crane’s mask. CRANE (CONT’D) ...much as you’re doing now. Crane TOWERS over Falcone, FLAMING EYES and FLAMING MOUTH Falcone SCREAMS.  136 137 138 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crane emerges with his briefcase. The Prison Official hov outside. SCREAMS ECHO from inside the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he’s not faking. Not that one. The Prison Official nods gravely. Crane leans in. CRANE (CONT’D) I’1l talk to the Judge, see if I can get him moved to the secure wing at Arkham. I can’t treat him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COAST GUARD HELICOPTER touches down on the back of a heavily damaged DESERTED CARGO SHIP. Two COAST GUARDSMEN with FLASHLIGHTS jump onto the deck of the ship to take a look around. BAFFLED. The deck is lined with HOLES. The Coast Guardsman shines his light into a MASSIVE HOLE. INT. EARLE’S OFFICE, WAYNE INDUSTRIES -- AFTERNOON 138 Earle is at his desk. A EXECUTIVE walks in, TROUBLED.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: We have a situation.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: What kind of situation?

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Coast guard picked up one of our cargo ships last night. Heavily damaged. Crew missing, probably ead.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Ship was carrying a prototype weapon. A microwave emitter...  139 140 141 142 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMY BRASS and SCIENTISTS waiting for a demonstration... industrial MACHINE the size of a small van sits on the ground a hundred feet from a WATER TOWER...

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It’s designed for desert warfare- it uses focused microwaves to vaporize the enemy’s water supply... The Scientists and Brass don goggles. Fire up the machine the water tower starts SHAKING... then EXPLODES in a CLOU OF STEAM that drifts towards the observers like FOG. INT. EARLE’S OFFICE, WAYNE INDUSTRIES -- CONTINUOUS 140

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: It looks like someone fired it up at sea- judging from the damage to the ship and cargo.

dialogues.speaker: EARLE
dialogues.text: What about the weapon? The Executive shifts, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: It’s missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUGATI VEYRON (looks, and costs, a million) pulls up to the valet station. Wayne emerges, impeccably tailored, fr the driver side. The VALETS scramble to the passenger sid Open the door to find TWO BLONDES, one on the other’s lap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tables around a decorative infinity pool. Earle and his GUESTS at a table. Earle sees Wayne enter with the Blonde He sighs. Then waves.  143 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table is littered with bottles and empty plates.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE GUEST
dialogues.text: At least he’s getting something done.

dialogues.speaker: MALE GUEST
dialogues.text: Bruce, help me out here. Wayne turns from the Blondes. They stand up and walk over the pool. Wayne smiles, turns to the Female Guest.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: A guy who dresses up like a bat clearly has issues.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE GUEST
dialogues.text: But he put Falcone behind bars-

dialogues.speaker: MALE GUEST
dialogues.text: And now the cops are trying to bring him in, so what does that tell you?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE GUEST
dialogues.text: They’re jealous? Wayne watches as, behind them, one of the Blondes slips o her dress and lowers herself into the pool... the other o giggling, follows her lead.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: If he’s so benevolent why does he hide his face?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE GUEST
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s protecting the people he cares about from reprisals. Wayne nods, considering. The MAITRE D’ slides up, annoyed MAITRE’ D Sir, the pool is for decoration, and your friends do not have swim wear.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Well, they’re European. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 CONTINUED: (2) 81. MAITRE’ D I’m going to have to ask you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (turns to Earle) Mr.Earle, I’m buying this hotel. Will you please broker a deal? Earle nods. Patiently. WAYNE (CONT’D) (turns to Maitre D’) I think we should make some new rules for the pool area, don’t you? The Maitre D’ stares at Wayne. Dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bruce! The Blondes beckon Wayne. He comes to the edge of the poo

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Ladies? They SPLASH him. Earle turns away, shaking his head. Behi him, out of focus, Wayne is PULLED into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and the Blondes, wet hair, in white HOTEL ROBES, waiting. The Valet pulls up in the Bugati.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bruce? Wayne turns. Rachel is standing there, dressed for dinner Stunning.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDES
dialogues.text: (from car) Come on, Bruce. We have some more hotels we want you to buy. Rachel glances at the Blondes. Then back to Wayne. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 146 CONTINUED: (2) 82.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’d heard you were back. (Wayne nods) Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Oh, kind of all over, you know.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (tense) No, Bruce, I don’t. And neither did a lot of people. People who thought you were probably dead.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You didn’t?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I never quite gave up on you. Wayne looks at her. Thinking. Gestures towards the Bugati

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Rachel, all that... that’s not me, inside I’m... different. I’m-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The same great little kid you used to be? Bruce, deep down, your friends out there are great, too. It’s not who you are underneath... (pokes his chest) But what you do that defines you. Rachel moves past him. Wayne stands there, eyes burning. INT. GORDON’S APARTMENT -- EVENING 145 Gordon’s pregnant wife, BARBARA tries to get their TWO-YE OLD to eat. Gordon KISSES her, picks up the trash. EXT. BACK ALLEY, GORDON’S APARTMENT -- CONTINUOUS 146 Gordon sticks the lid on the trash can. THUNDER rolls around.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gonna rain, huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What do you want, Flass? Flass, leaning on his car, feigns offence. Pulls a pint bottle from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: How’s Barbara? The kid? Gordon takes a drag, eyeing Flass coldly. FLASS (CONT’D) Another one on the way, right? Big responsibility. And when you’re on a big case like Falcone... lot of time away from here.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Cut to it, Flass.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: Just saying it’s good the case is clear cut- you’1l wrap it up easy. Flass finishes his bottle. Throws it at the trash cans.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You come around here making threats, pretending to be liquored up... tells me you’re scared.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: (cold) Take care of yourself, pal. Gordon watches him head back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Trouble? Gordon looks up: Batman is crouched in the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (shrugs) The scum’s getting jumpy because you stood up to Falcone.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: It’s a start. Your partner was at the docks with Falcone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: He moonlights as a low-level enforcer.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: There was another man. Testing the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (surprised) It wasn’t a buy- why risk opening a package on the docks?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Flass knows.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: He won’t talk.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: He’1l1 talk to me. Gordon looks up. Close on Batman, in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Commissioner Loeb set up a massive task force to catch you. He thinks you’re dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: What do you think? Gordon gets to his feet, dusts off his pants.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: I think you’re trying to help... Gordon looks up. But Batman is gone. GORDON (CONT’D) ...but I’ve been wrong before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three MEN walk through the canyons of shipping containers checking the tags with a flashlight. They stop at one.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMS AGENT
dialogues.text: This is the one I’m talking about.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK EMPLOYEE 1
dialogues.text: What’s your problem with it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 CONTINUED: (2) 85.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMS AGENT
dialogues.text: It shouldn’t exist. This ship left Singapore with 246 containers and arrived with 247. Probably dead illegals. You got a strong stomach? They HAUL the doors open. The Customs Agent looks inside: industrial machine the size of a small van. His torch pic out the WAYNE INDUSTRIES logo on the side. CUSTOMS AGENT (CONT’D) What the hell is this thing? BEHIND HIM: Dock Employee 1 raises a SILENCED GUN. FIRES. Dock Employee 2 helps DRAG the body into the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. Flass stuffs falafel into his mouth. Grabs a banknote from the VENDOR. Flass walks down a dark street. YANKED from the pavement, he’s PULLED up between building falafel falling, UP and UP until face-to-face with. The Batman. Rain pouring off his cowl. Holding Flass by his ankle. Flass is SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Who was with Falcone at the docks?

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I swear to God-

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Swear to ME. Batman DROPS Flass three flights down on the wire. PULLS TAUT- WHIPS him back up.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: (terrified whispers) I never knew his name... never... Sometimes shipments went to this guy before they went to the dealers-

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: There was something else in the drugs, something hidden- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 150 CONTINUED: (2) 86.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: I don’t know- something! I never went to the drop-off- it’s in the Narrows- cops can’t go into the Narrows except in force...

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Batman can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ISLAND IN GOTHAM RIVER: a ramshackle LABYRINTH of crumbling public housing, makeshift additions GROWING LIK FUNGUS AROUND AN INSANE ASYLUM. A walled city. Slick with rain. Batman LANDS, CROUCHING, looking at the windows of a WAREHOUSE built around the supports of the MONORAIL track

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman slips through a louver, drops SILENTLY to the floo amidst. By the freight elevator is a massive shipping cra Batman leaps up onto its lid- pries it open. Inside: the industrial machine the size of a small van. Batman sees the WAYNE INDUSTRIES logo and a number:

dialogues.speaker: M-EMIT.42B
dialogues.text: NOISES. Batman melts into the shadows. THREE MEN enter. T are the Dock Employees. The third is Crane.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK EMPLOYEE 1
dialogues.text: The boss wants you to keep it in the asylum until the time comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, leave the body. Torch the place. No traces. The Thugs pull the Customs Agent’s body out then push the crate onto the elevator. Crane notices RAIN spattering of the open louver. He steps towards it. Thug 2 turns from t elevator holding a Molotov cocktail. LIGHTS it- A cord WRAPS around the BOTTLE- YANKS it into the shadows Its fuse is EXTINGUISHED. The Thugs STARE at the darkness (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 CONTINUED: (2) 87. Batman RIPS from the shadows- Thug 1 pulls a gun- Batman SMASHES his arm to the ground. Thug 2 moves in from the side- is DROPPED by a fast elbow to the neck. Batman turns to Crane- now wearing his MASK. Carne’s hand FLASHES towards Batman, who DODGES a small puff of SMOKE. Batman moves for Crane- COUGHS, CHOKES- losing BALANCE- GASPING... Batman looks at Crane, sees a monster: FLAMING EYES, ELONGATED LIMBS, SPINNING like a DERVISH... Batmen REELS, in the throws of a hallucination. Crane SMASHES the BOTTLE over him, soaking him with GASOLINE... Batman LURCHES for the windows, IMAGES ASSAULTING his min INSERT CUT: BATS EXPLODE from the DARK CREVICE- Batman TURNS to Crane. Who holds a FLAMING LIGHTER. CRANE (CONT’D) Need a light? Crane TOSSES the lighter at Batman... who BURSTS into FLAMES. INSERT CUT: Ra’s Al Ghul OPENS his BOX- BATS BURST FORTH- Batman, IN FLAMES, SPINS- LEAPS desperately at the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman SMASHES through the window, CLOAK ABLAZE... FALLING... tries to ACTIVATE his CLOAK- but only gets one side to POP OPEN... the deployed wing causes him to SPIRA INSERT CUT: Young Bruce FALLING, FALLING in the well shaf Batman PLUMMETS, trailing flame, UNOPENED WING FLUTTERING with the violent FLAPPING of- BATS: SCREECHING, FLAPPING, FLUTTERING DARKNESS... Batman’s STIFF WING HOOKS a RAILING- SLOWS him with a JOLTRIPS- DROPPING him to the ground with a CRASH... Young Bruce HITS the dirt at the bottom of the SHAFT- ...and a SIZZLE, as wet pavement DAMPS the flames, GROANI Batman ROLLS his burning batsuit along the asphalt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152 153 CONTINUED: (2) 88. Batman, smoldering, LURCHES into an alley, raises his grapnel gun, FIRES up at the enclosed roof- RIDES up- PUNCHES his way through wire and metal, CRAWLS onto his back, STARING up at the skyscrapers of Gotham. Rain blurr his vision. Insert cut: Young Bruce watches his Father CRUMPLE- Batman FUMBLES at his belt. Pulls out a tiny phone.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Alfred?! Alfred?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred DRIVES, looks through the rear-view mirror at Batm who lies in the back, FLINCHING at invisible antagonists.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: BLOOD! Alfred?! Blood! A sample- take a sa- sample- poisoned... To Batman- the car is FILLED WITH BATS... Mefistofle rises... Young Bruce in the throws of his PANIC ATTACK GULPS AIR- turns to his Father, LOOKS him in the eye and CONDEMNS HI

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRUCE
dialogues.text: (shouting) We HAVE to go NOW, Dad!! Young Bruce DRAGS his parents from their seats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne awakes. Shivering. Red-eyed from crying. Alfred sit at his bedside, watching over him.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (hoarse) How long did I sleep?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Two days. It’s your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: It was some kind of gas... I only breathed the slightest amount... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I dread to think, sir, what would’ve happened if you’d had a lungful.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’ve felt those effects before... but this was much more potent.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I took a blood sample and sent it to a laboratory known discreet both discreet... (hands Wayne paper) ...and prompt bloodwork

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (reading) Protein-based compounds... might be possible to work up an antidote.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Shall I contact Wayne Pharmaceutical?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I’ve got a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox looks over the toxicology report. Looks up at Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: This was in your blood?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: It’s some kind of weaponized hallucinogen. Administered in aerosol form.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Mr.Wayne, you are definitely hanging out at the wrong clubs.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Could you synthesize an antidote?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Well, the hallucinatory compounds can be balanced... but this receptor’s a compound I’ve never seen before. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (reaches for paper) So you can’t.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: (snatches it away) Did I say that? I just want you to know how hard it’s gonna be. Fox puts the report on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Do you know what a Wayne Industries M-Emit42B is?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: No. But she will... Fox starts typing on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: FOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: It won’t tell us... (turns to Wayne) It must be a defense prototype.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Could you find out?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: I’11 make a couple calls... I still have a couple friends in defense. 155 INT. D.A.’S OFFICE -- AFTERNOON 155 Gordon finds it. Knocks. Rachel looks up from her desk.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gordon?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Councilor. Thanks for seeing me. Gordon enters, shuts the door behind himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON (CONT’D) (they shake hands) Will Finch go the distance on Falcone?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’1l have to because of the press.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What about Judge Phelan?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Someone gave me leverage.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: who?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’d rather not say.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (shrugs) There’s a loose thread on the Falcone case- I want to see what unravels higher up. I’m told you can be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (smiles) I’d rather not say. Rachel looks at Gordon, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Gordon, we’re working for a masked vigilante. Maybe from a rival gang.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: My gut says he’s okay. And he’s getting things moving in this town.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And when he gets bolder with success? Goes too far?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Councilor, this guy took down a dozen of Gotham’s most vicious wiseguys single-handed and without killing one of them- he’s plenty bold already. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: If he takes a life... it’s on us. Gordon looks at her. Nods. A KNOCK at the door. Wayne put his head around the door. Rachel stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I’1l1 come back.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: I was just leaving, Mr.Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, have we..?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Gordon. Sergeant. No, I just recognized you. From your pictures. Wayne nods. Gordon looks at Rachel, nods goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (cold) What do you want, Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I wanted to invite you a party-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: A party. Great. Just what I need...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Today’s my birthday. And I wanted to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don’t owe an apology, Bruce. You are who you are. It’ simple. I don’t have the right to expect anything more.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I thought you could never quite give up on me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is the party at the house? I miss it.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I hate the place. I’d tear it down if I could. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (appalled) Bruce, don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: The place is nothing without the people who made it what it was. Now there’s only Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And you. Rachel looks at him. An ASSISTANT sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: It’s Falcone. They moved him to Arkham Asylum on suicide watch.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Who authorized that?!

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Judge Bentley, on the advice of the head psychiatrist, Dr.Jonathan Crane. Rachel starts getting her things together.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Get Crane there right now- don’t take no for an answer... and call Dr.Lehmann, we’1l need our own assessment on the Judge’s desk by morning. The Assistant nods, leaves. Rachel heads for the door. RACHEL (CONT’D) Guess I won’t make your party...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You’re going to Arkham now? It’s in the Narrows, Rachel. Rachel gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You have yourself a great time- some of us have work to do. She hurries past him. Stops. Turns. Looks at him, softer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 157 158 159 160 CONTINUED: (5) 94. RACHEL (CONT’D) Happy Birthday, Bruce. She races down the steps. Wayne watches her go, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne hurries through the hall. Alfred in pursuit. Tables food and decoration fill the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: But Master Wayne, the guests will be arriving. Wayne turns.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Keep them happy until I arrive. Tell them that joke you know. Wayne hurries off. Alfred watches him go, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne steps to the piano, hits 4 notes- the bookcase SWINGSOPEN. Wayne steps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne descends. Arrives at the top of a wrought iron SPIR STAIRCASE, steps onto the dumb waiter at its center. Wayne pulls a lever, RELEASING the lift which PLUMMETS VERTIGINOUSLY DOWN the CENTER of the SPIRALING stair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift hits the bottom with a great RATTLE of crimes. Wayne moves to a PADLOCKED BOX. Opens it: the BAT SUIT ha there- a PHANTOM, black eyes STARING back at him. He reac for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel’s car crosses the bridge to the Narrows.  161 162 163 95. INT. CRANE’S OFFICE, ARKHAM ASYLUM -- MOMENTS LATER 161 Rachel sits in front of Crane at his desk..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms.Dodson, there’s nothing to add to the report I filed with the judge.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, I have questions about your report. (off look) Such as, is it unusual for a 58-year old man with no history of mental illness to have a complete psychotic break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But this is a mental asylum for the criminally insane. The unusual is usual here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GLOWING WINDOW of Crane’s office. Batman, crouched on adjusts mikes in the ears of his cowl. INT. CRANE’S OFFICE -- CONTINUOUS 163

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But isn’t it convenient for Falcone to suddenly develop these symptoms when he’s about to be indicted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s nothing convenient about his symptoms, Miss Dodson. (smiles, sympathetic) Look, I doubt we’re even supposed to be having this conversation, but off the record... Crane RISES, motioning.  164 165 166 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ORDERLY talking to a NURSE. Crane leads Rachel past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re not talking about a few easily-manufactured eccentricities. Crane stops at a door. Motions Rachel to look: Falcone STRAPPED to the bed. He STARES at the door, mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: FALCONE
dialogues.text: Scarecrow... S-scarecrow... S-S...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’s "scarecrow"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patients suffering delusional episodes often focus their paranoia onto an external tormentor, usually one conforming to the Jungian archetypes. (shrugs) In this case, a scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman, upside down, CLINGS to the wall above the window the end of the corridor. He RACKS AUDIO FOCUS THROUGH the Orderly’s conversation, SETTLING on Crane’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks at Falcone, mumbling, delusional.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s drugged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Psychopharmacology is my primary field- I’m a strong advocate. Crane turns to Falcone. Staring. CRANE (CONT’D) Outside, he was a giant. In here, only the mind can grant you power. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You enjoy the reversal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, smiles) I respect the mind’s power over the body. It’s why I do what I do.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (hard) And I do what I do to put scum like Falcone behind bars, not in therapy. I want my own psychiatric consultant to have full access to Falcone, including bloodwork to find out exactly what you have him on. Crane stares at her. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crane steps in, Rachel follows. He puts a key into the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing tomorrow, then.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Tonight. I’ve already paged Dr.Lehmann over at County General. Crane turns the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS you wish. The elevator descends. The doors open onto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, decrepit corridor. Water dripping, clearly disuse Crane steps off the elevator. Rachel follows, perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel follows Crane into a vast room: Tables stretch off into the room, covered in bags of powd scales, aluminum barrels and DOZENS OF INMATES working th powder, refining it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 171 172 CONTINUED: (2) 98. Armed THUGS look up, curious. Crane surveys the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where we make the medicine. Perhaps you should have some. Clear your head. He turns, but Rachel is gone. Crane smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel RACES into the elevator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel HITS the 2nd floor button. Nothing. She HITS all t buttons, floors the alarm... all dead without the key. The door opens to Crane’s MASKED FACE. He reaches out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo. A small puff of GAS sprays from his sleeve. Rachel RECOIL coughing, choking. She looks up at Crane: The eyeholes of the burlap mask are FLAMING. Rachel SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs DRAG Rachel into the room. The inmates stare blankly, clearly drugged. Crane turns Rachel’s reluctant face to look up at his mask. She GULPS PANIC BREATHS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows you’re here? Rachel SHAKES her head. CRANE (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: WHO KNOWS
dialogues.text: Rachel PULLS away, BURYING her head in her arms. THE LIGHTS GO OUT. The Thugs look around, unnerved. Crane PULLS OFF his mask (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs The First (2) 99. CRANE (CONT’D) (fascinated) He’s here.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST THUG
dialogues.text: who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The batman. exchange nervous glances.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST THUG
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What anyone does when a prowler comes around. (off look) Call the police. Thug looks at Crane.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: You want the cops here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, they’re irrelevant. But the Batman... he has a talent for disruption. Let the cops wrangle him. CRANE (CONT’D) Force him outside, the police will take him down. (indicates inmates) Get them out of here.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST THUG
dialogues.text: (indicates Rachel) What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s gone. I gave her a concentrated dose. The mind can only take so much.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND THUG
dialogues.text: The things they say about him... Can he really fly?  173 174 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman’s cape FLUTTERS as he SWINGS down two stories, LANDING at the high windows of the derelict corridor.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD THUG
dialogues.text: I heard he can disappear - Crane backs into the shadows, smiling at the Third Thug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’1l find out, won’t we? The Thugs move either side of the door... GLASS SMASHES, across the room- a Shadow drops from a high window. Rache SCREAMS. The two thugs advance through the darkness. Second thug is GRABBED from above- PULLED UP, SCREAMING, into the blackness of the rafters. The First Thug peers up into the darkness, gun aimed. A SHADOW DESCENDS, SHOUTING- First Thug FIRES- the Shadow CRUMPLES onto him. It is the Second Thug- First Thug ROLL the body off, SCRAMBLES to his feet- Batman STRIKES him f behind, KNOCKING him unconscious. SIRENS outside, close. Batman looks at Rachel- Crane BURSTS from the shadows, arm high, aimed at Batman’ face- Batman grabs his arm, DUCKING away from the puff of GAS from Crane’s sleeve... Batman SPINS Crane, RIPPING of his mask, WRENCHES his arm around to his own face, RIPS Crane’s jacket open and pulls out the BLADDER full of tox

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Taste of your own medicine, doctor? Crane’s eyes go wide as Batman SQUEEZES the bladder and a choking cloud of dust sprays into Crane’s face... Crane falls to the ground, CHOKING. Batman turns him over pulls his face up to meet his. BATMAN (CONT’D) Who are you working for?! Crane’s eyes are wide with TERROR. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 175 CONTINUED: (2) 101. Batman is a DEATH’S HEAD- black eyes, fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ra’s... Ra’s... Al Ghul... Batman reacts, pulls Crane tighter.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Ra’s Al Ghul is dead, Crane! who are you really working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Crane just STARES at him, EYES GLAZING- MIND FLYINGIMAGES CASCADING THROUGH HIS FEVERED BRAIN... Crane smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Crane isn’t here right now, but if you’d like to make an appointment - Sirens outside. Batman TURNS to Rachel. Through her eyes: Batman is a towering HORNED, WINGED DEMON... Rachel LASHES OUT at the demon with all her might... Batm applies a GRIP to her neck that renders her unconscious. cop (over bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: SURRENDER. YOU ARE SURROUNDED.
dialogues.text: Batman RISES, carrying Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS surround the building. COPS have guns drawn, WAITING. STAFF emerge, blinking, from the darkened asylum Flass and Gordon arrive. Flass shouts at the Uniforms:

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: What’re you waiting for?!

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: Backup.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: Backup?! Flass gestures at the DOZEN police cars outside the building. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: The Batman’s in there. SWAT’s on the way, but if you want to go now... (smiles) I’m right behind you, sir. Flass turns to Gordon. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: FLASS
dialogues.text: SWAT’s on the way. Gordon shakes his head. Approaches the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman carries Rachel, cloak BILLOWING in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon moves through the dark, gun drawn, eyes FLICKING t terrified NURSES who make their way to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT OFFICERS pour out of vans, RACE up the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon tries the elevator- it is dead. He enters the STAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT team BURSTS in- FLASHLIGHTS on RIFLES SCAN the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon locks down the stairwell- the way down to the disu wing is fenced off. He heads up- and is GRABBED and SWUNG OUT into the stairwell. Batman holds him as they ROCKET UPWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What -! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 182 183 CONTINUED: (2) 103. Batman covers Gordon’s mouth- down below: the door SMASHE OPEN- SWAT team lights CROSS the darkened stairwell. Batm PULLS Gordon into the rafters. Gordon turns, FURIOUS- see Rachel. Lying in a storage space/open attic. Twitching: GORDON (CONT’D) (whispering) What’s happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Crane poisoned her with his toxin. He was the third man at the docks.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Let me take her down to the medics-

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: They can’t help her. But I can. THE LIGHTS COME ON- bleaching the stairwell- Batman, Rach and Gordon are in the shadow of the attic. Batman reaches down to his boot. Presses a SWITCH in the heel, producing a barely audible HIGH-FREQUENCY WHINE. BATMAN (CONT’D) (indicates Rachel) I need to get her the antidote before the damage becomes permanent.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: How long does she have?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Not long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange SQUEALING SOUND rises. Flass looks around, curious. A dark CLOUD crosses the moon... not a regular cloud...

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Get her downstairs, meet me in the alley on the Narrows side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: How will you get out?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (indicates his boot) I called for backup. Crane’s been refining his toxin, stockpiling it.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What was he planning?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but he’s been working for someone else. Gordon frowns at the loud SQUEALING noise.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flass SCREAMS- Cops DIVE for cover as BATS- thousands upo thousands- DESCEND on the Asylum, HEADING for the windows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windows SHATTER INWARDS as bats POUR into the building-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon covers Rachel as he carries her down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bats FLOOD into the bright stairwell, SOARING UP past the cowering SWATS, a BLACK MASS RISING, DARKENING the stairwell. Batman amidst the bats. Calm. Pulls the sounder out of hi heel, leans over the stairwell and DROPS it... Bats CYCLONE down the stairwell, FOLLOWING the signal. Batman JUMPS into the center of the black cyclone- HIDDEN FALLING...  188 189 190 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman OPENS his cloak with a JOLT- lands HARD. He moves calmly through the bats, slipping past COWERING SWATS, moving past cell doors. Inmates STARE, wide-eyed out thei windows as he passes. Batman turns to a cell door, pulls small package out of his utility belt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two inmates FLINCH as the door lock BLASTS open and the d is KICKED In- Batman STRIDES across the cell between them

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me- And BLASTS the window of their cell. He SLIDES out... one Inmate turns to the other.

dialogues.speaker: LUNATIC
dialogues.text: What’d I tell ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon lowers Rachel to the asphalt. She STIRS.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How is she? Gordon looks up to see Batman standing there. A SEARCHLIGHT from a chopper blasts them. Batman GRABS Rachel. Gordon points back to the street.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Take my car.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I bought mine. Batman has disappeared into the dark end of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Yours?

dialogues.speaker: BLINDING HEADLIGHTS FLARE. A MASSIVE ENGINE ROARS-
dialogues.text: Gordon DIVES out of the way as- The BATMOBILE comes flying out of the darkness... the matteblack, muscularity of the stealth-finished "car" BLO by. Gordon’s jaw drops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 191 192 193 194 195 196 CONTINUED: (2) 106. GORDON (CONT’D) I gotta get me one of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman DRIVES. Rachel, COMING TO, hangs on, TERRIFIED. A CAR pulls across the alley- Batman hits the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SPEEDS towards the cop car-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops GAWP at the Batmobile, BRACING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SMASHES into the cop car, huge front tires CRUSHING the bonnet, BOUNCING the Batmobile right over th cop car in a messy display of brute force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile TEARS left, and ACCELERATES down the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops are scrunched down. One of them GRABS the radio. CoP 1 He’s in a vehicle!

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: (over radio) Make and color? coP 1 It’s a black... (turns to partner. who shrugs) ... tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile WEAVES around traffic, DODGING freeway supports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel BRACES against the dash, BREATHING FAST, staring a the road ahead... through her eyes: SPEED: pure, visceral SENSATION- lights STREAKING, column FLASHING past at unthinkable velocity-

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: You’ve been poisoned. Stay calm. He looks at an intricate GPS display, then at the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile RACES along- JUMPS lights, nimbly DODGING through the cross-traffic. Two Cop Cars join the pursuit from the cross streets, lights BLAZING, sirens BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman spots the Cops on a rear-view monitor, FLIPS a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile DROPS SPIKE STRIPS onto the road... the Cop Cars hit them- tires EXPLODE- rims light SPARKS as they GRIND, skidding SIDEWAYS, one laying into the other. Up ahead: the Batmobile SLALOMS outside of the freeway supports, ROLLS over the sidewalk, NIPS back into the roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IMPATIENT COP is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: COP 3
dialogues.text: At least tell me what it looks like... His eyes WIDEN: the Batmobile ROARS past. A shadowy MONST (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 203 204 205 206 207 208 CONTINUED: (2) 108. CoP 3 (CONT’D) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile comes out from under the elevated freeway a is hit by a SPOTLIGHT from a CHOPPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman glances at a row of BUTTONS- each one a tiny SCREE showing different views. Batman PUSHES one- that view fli onto the main display. Rachel is HYPERVENTILATING.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Breath slowly. Close your eyes. She does so. For an instant.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s worse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Cop Cars pull across the intersection in a ROADBLOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman SPOTS the ROADBLOCK in front. Touches the GPS scre the map becomes THREE-DIMENSIONAL (heights of building, levels of streets). Batman SKIDS into a turn-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SKIDS through the entrance to a multi-level PARKING GARAGE- TAKING OUT the ticket machine and barrier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile RACES upwards through the structure, the ca enormous width TAKING OUT PILLARS at every turn.  209 210 211 212 213 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel FLINCHES AWAY from the pillars-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?! !

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop Cars SMASH into DOWNED PILLARS in the Batmobile’s wak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile ROARS out onto the top level, and is LIT UP the CHOPPER. The Batmobile REVERSES into a spot marked "COMPACT", CRUSHING the cars either side, then RACES forward... Cop Cars emerge onto the roof, BLOCKING THE ONLY WAY DOWN... Batmobile SCREECHES to a HALT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman glances at his 3-d GPS. Then looks at Rachel. coP 3 (over loudspeaker )

dialogues.speaker: TURN OFF YOUR ENGINE
dialogues.text: She recoils, TERRIFIED by his mask, clawing at her harnes Batman puts his gloved hand on her frantic arms.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Trust me. Batman SLIDES into the FRONT DRIVING POSITION, body PRONE if riding a motorcycle, head in a glass POD between the front wheels. He HITS a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CANNONS emerge from the nose of the Batmobile- BLASTING t far wall... the massive JET ENGINE at the back IGNITES, i mouth ADJUSTING... FLAPS on the front and REAR of the car FLARE OUT like a PYTHON spreading its neck...  214 215 216 217 218 219 220 110. The Cops STARE. The Batmobile ROCKETS FORWARD... heading the GAP in the far wall... accelerating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel SCREAMS- Batman HITS another button-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INVERTED SPOILER JAMS INTO THE AIRSTREAM at the front the car, BUMPING it just off the ground, a RAMPLESS JUMP-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile JUMPS OFF the parking garage, soaring over thirty-foot gap to LAND HEAVILY on a neighboring FLAT ROO The Cops STARE at one another, open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman YANKS the steering left, hits the BOOST-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile TURNS- ROCKETS for the edge of the roof... SHOOTS over the gap to the next roof, CHOPPER IN PURSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman checks his 3-D GPS, ROCKETS forward, aiming at the next roof, a PITCHED CHATEAU-STYLE TILE ROOF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corp Cars SHOOT along, paralleling the rooftop chase...FR BELOW: the Chopper SWOOPS LOW over the buildings... A GLIMPSE of the Batmobile as it LEAPS across to the next building... coP 4 (over radio) We’re on him, we’re on him...  221 222 223 224 225 226 227 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile lands on the PITCHED ROOF, racing along at PRECARIOUS ANGLE, TILES SLIDING off the roof in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman’s forward-slung position is GYROSCOPICALLY BALANCE he is the only vertical element in the angled car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chased by the LOW-FLYING chopper, the Batmobile SWERVES u over the GABLES, roof CRUMBLING in its wake, RACING for t end of the roof which PARALLELS an ELEVATED FREEWAY. The Batmobile rockets forward- JUMPS THE LAST GABLE... DR onto the elevated FREEWAY, TRAFFIC SWERVING to avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop Cars see the Batmobile disappear onto the freeway abo coP 4 Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman’s display shows a RADAR SWEEP and PLOTS a course through the differing speeds of the lanes. He pilots, LEANING left and right like a motorcyclist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SWERVES- the Chopper’s light stays trained. TRAFFIC gets heavier. Cop Cars are CLOSING IN from behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman lifts himself back into the REAR DRIVING POSITION- THROTTLES BACK- KILLS all the lights, and the ENGINE.  228 229 230 231 232 233 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile DROPS BACK, DARK... the Chopper LOSES IT. T Batmobile CRUISES across the lanes, a WRAITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE, but for the steady WHINE of the ELECTRIC MOTOR. Rachel BREATHES in the sudden quiet. Eyes flickering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SLICES across lanes, a SHADOW only visible BREAKING the GLARE of other cars’ HEADLIGHTS. The Cop Car pull forward, driving parallel, an empty lane between the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel stares at Batman in the intimate quiet. Her eyes a glaring. Her breathing is shallow.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: quiet (Stay with me.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cop turns left to look at the other Cop Car.

dialogues.speaker: COP 3
dialogues.text: Where’d he-? He sees, between his car and the next, a BLACK SHAPE. COP 3 (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPOTLIGHT hits the car- Batman HITS a button- the mai engine ROARS to life- Batman SLIPS into the prone positio Hits the BOOST.  234 235 236 237 238 239 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SHOOTS forward from between the two Cop Car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile’s JET WASH BLASTS the windscreen, SHATTERIN it, the Cop throws his hands in front of his face-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cop Car SPINS out of its lane, SLAMMING into the guar rail as the Batmobile RACES ahead, weaving through traffi The Batmobile slides onto a TIGHTLY-CURVING EXIT RAMP... FLIES off the ramp, JUMPING DOWN onto the frontage road below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman KILLS the lights, running on NIGHT VISION. Rachel’ eyes flicker at the EERIE green view of ghostly trees, he breathing FASTER and still more SHALLOW.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Hold on. Just hold on. Batman YANKS A LEVER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ground ANCHOR DIGS into the road, WHIPPING the Batmobil RIGHT in a HARD TURN, down a small turnoff... the Chopper LOSES the Batmobile, pursuing Cop Cars BLAZE PAST the turnoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, crying, looks at the monstrous shapes of the tree FLICKERING, jagged tree shapes SPIN past DIZZYINGLY

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Rachel? Rachel?! No reply. Up ahead: a LOOKOUT over a river gorge. Batman PUSHES the Batmobile, SPEEDING towards the lookout. Rache glazes eyes REGISTER the danger- she TWISTS, PANICKED...  240 241 242 243 244 245 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile ROCKETS off the edge of the lookout, over t gorge, FLYING STRAIGHT AT THE FACE OF A WATERFALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel SCREAMS as they SPLASH INTO THE FACE OF THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -AND EMERGE THROUGH THE CURTAIN OF WATER into the BATCAVE The Batmobile’s ground ANCHORS hook a steel CABLE, spinni an INERTIA REEL bolted to the cave wall, YANKING the car a halt like a jet landing on an aircraft carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel BOUNCES in her seat. PASSED OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The canopy of the Batmobile hisses open in three complex sections, like insect wings IMPLODING. Batman LIFTS Rache from the cockpit, steps down onto wet shale... CARRIES he into the damp blackness of the caverns. Cloak BILLOWING in his wake, he heads for the GLOW of his work table. Gently lays Rachel on the table. RACKS up the scaffold to his computer station. A CONTAINER sits there with paperwork from Fox. Batman opens it, removes a VIAL. plugs it into a pneumatic SYRINGE, puts the syringe betwe his teeth- GLIDES off the scaffold, LANDING beside Rachel He INJECTS her in the biceps. Batman steps back, watching Rachel’s breathing SLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon surveys the scene: COPS and SWATS dig through the mess, interviewing Inmates and sifting rubble. A DETECTIV sits in a cell doorway examining Crane’s mask. Crane is huddled in the corner, STARING. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Is he cooperating?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: If by cooperating you mean chewing his way through three sets of restraints, then yes, he’s cooperating. Did we catch the Batman? Gordon tries not to smile.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Nope. A cop hurries over. CoP Sir, there’s something you should take a look at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiled baths and hydrotherapy equipment. A POOL in the center. The Cop leads Gordon to the edge... A massive HOL has been dug through the bottom. Dozens of ALUMINUM BARRELS sit alongside. Gordon climbs down, PEERS into the hole... A TORRENT of water runs at t bottom.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Looks like they tapped the mains... Gordon looks at the dozens of aluminum barrels. Realizing GORDON (CONT’D) Get me somebody at the water board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel’s eyes flicker open to the cavernous damp darkness She sees BATS banging high above. CLOSES her eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How do you feel? His voice ECHOES as if spoken from al shadows at once. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Where are we? Nothing. RACHEL (CONT’D) Why did you bring me here?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: If I hadn’t... your mind would now be lost. You were poisoned. Rachel thinks.., concentrating.., remembering.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I remember... nightmares. This... face, this... mask. (realizes) Crane. It was Crane- Rachel STRUGGLES off the table, trying to stand. RACHEL (CONT’D) I have to tell the police- we’ve got- She SLIPS- Batman is there, CATCHING her.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Rest. Gordon has Crane. In his arms she looks up at him- he lays her gently back onto the table. Retreats into shadow.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is Sergeant Gordon your friend?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t have the luxury of friends. Rachel watches this dark shadow hover just outside the light.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why did you save my life?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Gotham needs you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And you serve Gotham? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I serve justice. Rachel STARES at the solitary shadow. Fascinated. Pitying

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Perhaps you do. Batman steps into the light. Holding a pneumatic syringe two vials. Rachel stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to give you a sedative. You’11 wake up back at home... Batman holds up the two vials. BATMAN (CONT’D) And when you do, get these to Gordon, and Gordon alone. Trust no one.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: The antidote. One for Gordon to inoculate himself, the other to start mass-production. Batman hands Rachel the vials. She looks at him, curious. BATMAN (CONT’D) Crane was just a pawn. He was working for someone else.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (remembering) Ghul... something Al Ghul...

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Ra’s Al Ghul. It’s not him. He’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: I watched him die. Batman approaches with the syringe. Rachel offers her arm Batman injects her. Her eyes close. Batman removes his co Wayne stands above the sleeping Rachel. Stares at her for inexpressibly lonely moment.  248 249 250 251 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon is on the phone-

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Someone’s been dumping a dangerous contaminant into the supply from this location for days, maybe weeks-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two TECHNICIANS sit there, one on the phone to Gordon. A large screen in front of them maps the water supply of Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: If that’s true then it’s already spread through the whole system. But no one’s reported any effects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon looks around, thinking, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: It must be like chlorine or fluoride- harmless to drink, but when you breathe it it’s deadly... look, wake up your boss, see if there’s a way to flush out the system. Gordon hangs up. Frustrated. Notices something. A large SHIPPING CRATE. He turns to the Cop. GORDON (CONT’D) Open that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne emerges from the bookcase. The noise of a PARTY outside the door. Alfred is there waiting, dinner jacket over his arm. Wayne grabs the shirt- dressing hastily.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Rachel’s sedated. You can take her home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: Very good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Is Fox still here? (Alfred nods) Tell your staff to stop serving drinks and move everybody on after the cake. Alfred nods. Wayne moves to the door. Alfred STOPS him. Hands him a towel, gesturing at his face: Wayne is still wearing BLACK MAKEUP around his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of GUESTS. Music. Tables groaning with food

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE GUEST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There he is! Guests look up- Wayne WADES INTO the throng, GRINNING and GLAD-HANDING. The band strikes up with "Happy Birthday", Wayne spots Fox at the buffet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As sounds from the party drift over, Alfred gently arrang the unconscious Rachel on the rear seat of the car. He frowns as Rachel’s legs get stuck. He looks up to see a PARTY GUEST, cigarette in hand, staring, curious.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (smiles) A little the worse for wear, I’m afraid. Alfred YANKS Wayne’s gold clubs to one side, Rachel settl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests are leaving. Wayne works the room, charming, but distracted... heading to Fox.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Any word on that... item. Fox nods, glances around. Leans in, conspiratorial. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: A contact in heavy weapons tipped me off- it’s a microwave emitter. It vaporizes water. Wayne thinks.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Could you sue it to put a biological agent into the air?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
